commit_message:
Update get_endpoint to use credentials auth_url first

endpoint URL should use credentials class auth_url to
take advantage of replacing v2/v3 endpoint URL from
openrc or env vars. If lookup fails, fall back to
old lookup forms.

Added acceptance test runs with openrc and env vars.

Depends-On: I63278fbb34d4a2e37861d0ec411226feb27ef9dc
Change-Id: I33c932f3dd4bacf95e44d5291e7b3bdb1597974f
Related-Bug: #1479879

commit_message:
Changed fuel2 utility to support network template as file

Example of CLI call:

fuel2 network-template upload --file /tmp/test-file 1

Change-Id: I3b2a6b4bdb47e4135a9e808b47335ca73e004f44
Closes-Bug: #1483761

commit_message:
Add get/set boot mode to Management Interface

This blueprint is to add new functions get_boot_mode,set_boot_mode
to management Interface to get the current boot mode and to set the
boot mode for the next boot respectively.

Change-Id: I7827abe09dc4f1889499091b5b4772de832af58e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-15 11:54:44.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix to set value for name using nova list --fields option

You can see blank value for name when you use nova list --fields
Name,Networks.

This problem persists because name field is considered as a filter
formatter. This was not working when rendering the name in print
list function of utility file.

Change-Id: I7e0ef23d23488e4ac0282184f759ea5a1bdf6dc0
Closes-Bug: #1473399
'}]
commit_message:
Fix to set value for name using nova list --fields option

You can see blank value for name when you use nova list --fields
Name,Networks.

This problem persists because name field is considered as a filter
formatter. This was not working when rendering the name in print
list function of utility file.

Change-Id: I7e0ef23d23488e4ac0282184f759ea5a1bdf6dc0
Closes-Bug: #1473399

commit_message:
Make ComputeNode.service_id nullable to match db schema

The compute_node table was recently updated to make service_id column
nullable[1]. This mirrors that change to the ComputeNode object.

[1] 551be2c52a29cb2755de4825a3fcb2c8f7d7b3f1

Change-Id: I54e81fe7662039d4bf51babcbd2a0d597f98377a
Related-Bug: #1438189

commit_message:
Add network templates support for network verification

If network template is attached to cluster it should be used
in the network verification task to prepare list of network
interfaces, that will be used for network connectivity
verification.

Change-Id: I7b37033405b12790e71f3fcd72b6b40083aec9c3
Closes-Bug: #1481649

subject: Add interface driver for DHCP for routed networking
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 13734, 'name': 'Nell Jerram', 'email': 'nell@tigera.io', 'username': 'neiljerram'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-20 08:47:40.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/interface.py'], 'message': "Add interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = networking_calico.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq
  to listen on all the TAP interfaces and to treat those interfaces as
  aliases of the ns-XXX interface where the DHCP context and IP subnet
  are defined.

- The ns-XXX interface (for the DHCP port) is created as a dummy
  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

Change-Id: I0f237bc999e43522ad83e6d652f53068b7e9733c
Partial-Bug: #1472704
"}]
commit_message:
Add interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = networking_calico.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq
  to listen on all the TAP interfaces and to treat those interfaces as
  aliases of the ns-XXX interface where the DHCP context and IP subnet
  are defined.

- The ns-XXX interface (for the DHCP port) is created as a dummy
  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

Change-Id: I0f237bc999e43522ad83e6d652f53068b7e9733c
Partial-Bug: #1472704

commit_message:
post_test_hook is not executed when the gate test returns an error

Even if the gate test returns an error, we may need to get an error info.
This patch adds a new hook entitled post_test_error_hook is executed in
a case of the gate test error.

Change-Id: Ib3b21d9ec9dce840163f48c067e5329407aa72d3

commit_message:
Add cleaning_updated_at in the Nodes database

This patch is adding a new column for the Nodes database model called
'cleaning_updated_at'. This field is intent to keep track of last time
cleaning was updated so that a timeout mechanism for the cleaning
operation can be implemented.

Partial-Bug: #1483120
Change-Id: I182f816307f1f00247ebe987e0576402d201b959

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded IDs from NetworkGroup objects in net check test

The IDs of objects created in test_check_untagged_intersection_failed
are no longer hardcoded. They will instead use the next value of the
ID column sequence. This prevents conflicts between transient and
persistent objects in the SQLalchemy session as they will no longer
have the same identifier.

Change-Id: Ifaa3b2e3dfe950ef4b08fa6eb9f8217062ceca9d
Closes-bug: #1484936

subject: Add --may-exist to l3_agent recipe
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7128, 'name': 'Mark Vanderwiel', 'email': 'vanderwl@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kramvan'}, {'_account_id': 8112, 'name': 'Ma Wen Cheng', 'email': 'wenchma@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'wenchma'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 08:05:45.000000000', 'files': ['spec/l3_agent_spec.rb', 'recipes/l3_agent.rb'], 'message': 'Add --may-exist to l3_agent recipe

when external_network_bridge is not empty, and has been created in formal
deployment operation, at this time the external_network_interface should has
been added to the external_network_bridge, so if we run a update operation
on l3 agent recipe, it will try to add the interface to the bridge again,
that will return an error, add --may-exist to avoid it.

Change-Id: I40dabc862ae12dc4be81b196987b692a34c0c6c9
Partial-Bug: 1483994
'}]
commit_message:
Add --may-exist to l3_agent recipe

when external_network_bridge is not empty, and has been created in formal
deployment operation, at this time the external_network_interface should has
been added to the external_network_bridge, so if we run a update operation
on l3 agent recipe, it will try to add the interface to the bridge again,
that will return an error, add --may-exist to avoid it.

Change-Id: I40dabc862ae12dc4be81b196987b692a34c0c6c9
Partial-Bug: 1483994

subject: Override api_extensions_path in unit tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 156, 'name': 'Ryu Ishimoto', 'email': 'ryu@midokura.com', 'username': 'ryu-midokura'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 8837, 'name': 'Joe Mills', 'email': 'joe.h.mills@gmail.com', 'username': 'joemido'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-20 08:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Override api_extensions_path in unit tests

In order to be able to implement unit tests for FWaaS, the extension
path must be set to the midonet's in setup.  The reason is that FWaaS
puts its extension path twice, one in the CONF override and one
inserted by Neutron separately because it's a well-known advanced
service.  This is usually not a problem because one of the duplicated
paths gets removed when Neutron starts, but this dedup logic fails as
soon as you append a different extension path, causing Neutron to fail
to start.  This patch sets the extension path of the midonet plugin in
the test setup so that any duplicated paths that might exist in CONF
get overwritten completely.

Partially-implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-fwaas
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I8e5d7c8d7ee793f63346fe856e782c22d829dfe4
"}]
commit_message:
Override api_extensions_path in unit tests

In order to be able to implement unit tests for FWaaS, the extension
path must be set to the midonet's in setup.  The reason is that FWaaS
puts its extension path twice, one in the CONF override and one
inserted by Neutron separately because it's a well-known advanced
service.  This is usually not a problem because one of the duplicated
paths gets removed when Neutron starts, but this dedup logic fails as
soon as you append a different extension path, causing Neutron to fail
to start.  This patch sets the extension path of the midonet plugin in
the test setup so that any duplicated paths that might exist in CONF
get overwritten completely.

Partially-implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-fwaas
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I8e5d7c8d7ee793f63346fe856e782c22d829dfe4

commit_message:
Load ip_vs module for keepalived

If ip_vs is not loaded keepalived will enter a restart loop.  To fix that
load ip_vs module every time we start the container.

Change-Id: I6b39d8654cc6a6da7a9162e5c3efab073746b246

commit_message:
Updating cert_parser for cert loading

Will now load certificates with the provided cert manager.

This allows multilple driver implementations to reuse code
in regards to loading the certificate data from the certificate
manager, e.g. Barbican cert manager.

Change-Id: Id20acf49753c3f75b4152d351412e93394e72b17

commit_message:
Fix binary builds for oraclelinux templates

* Enable some extra repos for oraclelinux in the base template.

* Disable magnum binary builds for oraclelinux due to unavailable
  python-docker-py dependency

Change-Id: Iaf8826dc0f9ff93a40e5ad3d1c0fd1fb6ef2e048
Closes-Bug: 1486636

commit_message:
Set 'ip_ranges' notation for cluster networks

Since 'fuel-devops' allocates 1st IP of each network
for 'router', tests must set exact IP ranges which can
be used for environment. Otherwise 1st network IP could
be allocated for environment needs if gateway isn't used
in that network.

Change-Id: I215bbbe73685affd598daf50d6900cb166a06c69
Closes-bug: #1486759

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the instances on openstack.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current host to filter the instance.

"}]
commit_message:
Improve the performance of get evacuated instances from a host which should be destroyed

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the instances on openstack.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current host to filter the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1486026

Change-Id: I132eaf24c2243074dd9122041fb4feb0733e4737

commit_message:
Move experimental scenario gate jobs for Sahara to non-voting check

We've tested that jobs works okay and now we'd like to monitor how
this jobs will be working for all change requests. After some
period of time when we'll be sure that jobs works stable enough and
correctly, we'll make them voting (and add to gate pipeline too).

Change-Id: I322a330ff6e458a3de4d4bd5b8584e8f72814950

commit_message:
Enable debug logging for Nova, Glance, Cinder requests

Currently requests to these services are not logged with debug=True
config option by default. This makes debugging difficult.

Also set default log level for keystoneclient.auth to WARN, because it
floods logs with useless info.

Change-Id: Idfe2684b4146bb3c44159a08572e3c0eeff85f5f

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-14 17:04:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is
a deleted server. When trying to get servers with such a
marker, a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is
not found will be raised.

We now always pass read_deleted=yes if a marker is being used.

Change-Id: I79a1fb79a38ac4006db622590574308aafdcb5b5
Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086
'}]
commit_message:
Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is
a deleted server. When trying to get servers with such a
marker, a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is
not found will be raised.

We now always pass read_deleted=yes if a marker is being used.

Change-Id: I79a1fb79a38ac4006db622590574308aafdcb5b5
Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086

commit_message:

This is needed to break a dependency loop between the DRBD driver
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178573/
and the devstack plugin
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187568/,
to make progress on these ends.

commit_message:
pep8: replace deprecated calls to assert_()

The TestCase.assert_() has been deprecated in Python 2.7. Replace it
with assertTrue() or even better methods (assertIn, assertNotIn,
assertIsInstance) which provide better error messages.

Change-Id: I21c730351470031a2dabe5238693095eabdb8964

commit_message:

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-19 06:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Improve the performance of get evacuated instances from a host which should be destroyed

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the instances on openstack.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current host to filter the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1486026

Change-Id: I13505027f0652e7b06f8ad90b6b6a53855ee94ac
"}]
commit_message:
Improve the performance of get evacuated instances from a host which should be destroyed

When destory the evacuated instances from a host,it need to get the host's instance which are found on the hypervisor.
If the driver doesn't support uuids listing, it will get all the instances on openstack.
So we use evacuate instance's uuid which were evacuated from current host to filter the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1486026

Change-Id: I13505027f0652e7b06f8ad90b6b6a53855ee94ac

commit_message:
Add better dbapi support for querying reservation

This commit adds support for querying reservation of
a node by a list of desired conductor names.  It adds
a new filter 'reserved_by_any_of' which is expected to
be a list of conductors.

Change-Id: I149eae115fd3267e9b9efdb99aca445e7b18ba03
Closes-Bug: 1472212

subject: Reduce contention between update and delete
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 6995, 'name': 'Sridar Kandaswamy', 'email': 'skandasw@yahoo.com', 'username': 'skandasw'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 12999, 'name': 'James Arendt', 'email': 'james.arendt@hpe.com', 'username': 'jwarendt'}, {'_account_id': 14010, 'name': 'Ray Schneider', 'email': 'rmschn@gmail.com', 'username': 'rmschn'}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}, {'_account_id': 15330, 'name': 'Intel NGFW CI', 'email': 'ngfw-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ngfwci'}, {'_account_id': 15444, 'name': 'Cisco FWaaS CI', 'email': 'fwaas.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_fwaas_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-16 19:27:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Reduce contention between update and delete

When a delete comes right after an update, the firewall state
can change to ACTIVE right before the RPC message is sent over
the wire, but after the state was transitioned to PENDING_DELETE.

This ends up confusing the agent which sees a firewall being
deleted but with an ACTIVE state.

Deferring the state transition closer to the RPC message minimizes
the chances of a race, and forcing the right state in the payload
ensures that the agent gets what it needs.

Closes-bug: #1483875

Change-Id: I455bbe00395377509beca5ec1d54cf4f7a57152d
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce contention between update and delete

When a delete comes right after an update, the firewall state
can change to ACTIVE right before the RPC message is sent over
the wire, but after the state was transitioned to PENDING_DELETE.

This ends up confusing the agent which sees a firewall being
deleted but with an ACTIVE state.

Deferring the state transition closer to the RPC message minimizes
the chances of a race, and forcing the right state in the payload
ensures that the agent gets what it needs.

Closes-bug: #1483875

Change-Id: I455bbe00395377509beca5ec1d54cf4f7a57152d

commit_message:
Add links to tables in Config Ref Guide

The Cloud Admin Guide used two common tables that
were auto-generated for the XML version of the book.
These tables are not yet being generated for RST.
This patch replaces the xi:includes for these tables
with links to the tables in the Config Ref Guide.

Change-Id: I36a3c0c8f099ca752aace4c2880585949da3ed4a
Implements: blueprint reorganise-user-guides

commit_message:
Fix code that modified dictionaries while iterating over them

Since Python 3 doesn't make a copy of the keys when iterating, this code
would modify a dictionary while iterating over its keys, which is an
error.

Partial-Implements: blueprint porting-python3
Change-Id: Iaade169759217957be91d8aa00b5e9fe90241f5d

commit_message:
Cloning requirements repository before pip install

The commit 05aa3846a0402edc9cc49f4ba36f09592004b273 into devstack exposed a bug
where pip_install is called before the requirements repository is cloned. This
change ensures that the requirements repository exists before pip_install is
called.

Change-Id: I60b157fc98691764a69cf022852e7a95fc50cdd7
Closes-Bug: #1486304

commit_message:
Do git clone of reqs even earlier

Turns out the git clone of the reqs repo was not happening early enough
(There was a use of pip_install prior to the clone). Move it up prior to
that use so that contraints can be applied safely in all pip_install
cases.

Change-Id: If32e8e06ac70205b0aa382785c75bdb200b5b26e

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-18 23:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/extension_info.py', 'doc/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp.json.tpl'], 'message': 'Removing extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" from v2.1 extension-list

Extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" is not ported to v2.1, due to that
there is difference between v2 and v2.1 as mentioned in bug#1470690.

But v2.1 extension-list has "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension which convey that
this extension is also loaded for v2.1 and user will get the expected response
according to "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension which is not true as this extension
is not actually ported to v2.1.

It is decided that fix for that difference should go in microversion not
in base v2.1 as it is already released.

This patch remove extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" from v2.1 extension-list which
will actually convey that this extension is missing in v2.1.

Partial-Bug: 1470690

Depends-On: I3caca80a6c010b86150909126f4545425ed99e11

Change-Id: Ic99ac1179d02d907422911fe1369b64479fd5f33
'}]
commit_message:
Removing extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" from v2.1 extension-list

Extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" is not ported to v2.1, due to that
there is difference between v2 and v2.1 as mentioned in bug#1470690.

But v2.1 extension-list has "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension which convey that
this extension is also loaded for v2.1 and user will get the expected response
according to "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension which is not true as this extension
is not actually ported to v2.1.

It is decided that fix for that difference should go in microversion not
in base v2.1 as it is already released.

This patch remove extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" from v2.1 extension-list which
will actually convey that this extension is missing in v2.1.

Partial-Bug: 1470690

Depends-On: I3caca80a6c010b86150909126f4545425ed99e11

Change-Id: Ic99ac1179d02d907422911fe1369b64479fd5f33

commit_message:
Remove tie between system_metadata and extra.flavor

This removes the implicit link between system_metadata and extra.flavor in
the Instance object code when calculating columns to join. This makes us
actually stop querying one when we query for the other, a net win in terms
of database traffic.

This mostly has impacts only on unit tests that mock these calls.

Change-Id: I073305c2fb9bc448c5ed33d0edfab9399bbd319b

commit_message:
Just use constraints everywhere

Having behavior on your laptop diverge from behavior in the gate is
confusing. Just use constraints on every devstack run to be consistent.
Users of devstack can edit the requirements repo in order to change
these constraints locally if necessary.

Change-Id: I843208e2e982eb04931b76f5cb4bd219fbcd70de

commit_message:
Use correct return value in cluster_action module

'RES_FAILED' is not an available retuan value. 'RES_ERROR' should
be used when error happened during action progress. This patch
fixed two error usage in cluster_action module.

Change-Id: I40e96784b1ca0bf707d31bb64115fca5536f1562

commit_message:
Huawei driver support dedup, compression, thin and thick

Manila "share types" may contain qualified extra-specs -
extra-specs that have significance for the backend driver
and the CapabilityFilter.

This commit makes the Huawei driver report the following
boolean capabilities:
  * capabilities:dedupe
  * capabilities:compression
  * capabilities:thin_provisioning

The scheduler will choose a host that supports the needed
capability when the CapabilityFilter is used and a share
type uses one or more of the following extra-specs:
  * capabilities:dedupe='<is> True' or '<is> False'
  * capabilities:compression='<is> True' or '<is> False'
  * capabilities:thin_provisioning='<is> True' or '<is> False'

Change-Id: I8942ade76e04de7670306434d0479ad334940cc8
Implements blueprint huawei-driver-support-dedup-compression-thin-thick

commit_message:
Add is_domain field in Project Table

Provides the basic storage of 'is_domain' field in project table.
This flag is not interpreted anywhere yet and is set as False by
default in manager level. We currently do not allow the creation or
seeing a project with this flag set to True via the REST API.
We will allow these operations in subsequent patches.

This attribute is only available in v3. Hence, it's filtered in v2.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I190e1dd04b1474703804de1fb212340fe6626c13
Partially-Implements: bp reseller

commit_message:
Store "null api version" as 0.0

Nova API doesn't have 0 version, so we can use 0.0 for Null APIVersion.
It will help to write simple comparison methods.

Change-Id: I9010007e6e5a92a378299ccb0d674b30fdabc365

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 11:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/ironic/ironic_states.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: Check for CLEANWAIT state when polling for unprovisioned

Ironic introduced the CLEANWAIT state [1] to differentiate when a cleaning
task is being executed out-of-band (sync, CLEANING) or out-of-band
(async, CLEANWAIT). This patch makes the Nova Ironic driver aware of the
CLEANWAIT state when considering that a node have been unprovisioned
already (CLEANING/CLEANWAIT happens *after* the node been deleted).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200152/

Change-Id: Ia2fd11246c095a71c8acaf5be81052675a1c21c0
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Check for CLEANWAIT state when polling for unprovisioned

Ironic introduced the CLEANWAIT state [1] to differentiate when a cleaning
task is being executed out-of-band (sync, CLEANING) or out-of-band
(async, CLEANWAIT). This patch makes the Nova Ironic driver aware of the
CLEANWAIT state when considering that a node have been unprovisioned
already (CLEANING/CLEANWAIT happens *after* the node been deleted).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200152/

Change-Id: Ia2fd11246c095a71c8acaf5be81052675a1c21c0

See spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of account and container
user-metadata.  Also decrypts container listing.

This commit message will be updated with a vagrant setup when
one becomes available.  Until then, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

When using encryption middleware, the functests have 8 errors and 17

because of the proxy/controllers/obj.py change in patch 193749.

Change-Id: I750885fde196ad798ab38a480f19f600f81efcfc
"}]
commit_message:
Encrypting/Decrypting account and container metadata

See spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of account and container
user-metadata.  Also decrypts container listing.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
This commit message will be updated with a vagrant setup when
one becomes available.  Until then, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

When using encryption middleware, the functests have 8 errors and 17
failures.  These are due to not having COPY implemented, and not
having a good solution for handling conditional GET.

Two unittests fail.  test_sysmeta_not_updated_by_POST_as_copy fails
because of the proxy/controllers/obj.py change in patch 193749.
This can't be fixed until we find a better way to persist object
crypto-meta.

Change-Id: I750885fde196ad798ab38a480f19f600f81efcfc

in favor of generic option ssh_conn_timeout.

Config parameter eqlx_cli_timeout parameter will be
removed in M release

Closes Bug: #1484284

commit_message:
group pollsters by interval

there was a regression in code which led to discrete polling tasks
being created per pipeline. while logical, this meant that the cache
between tasks with same interval never got shared and therefore
duplicate calls were made.

Change-Id: I72876f61a73f4ca2f4ca48aebb1489ce7ebb702e
Related-Bug: #1480442

fix policy.json to not allow tenants to create policies or rules
by default and allow tenants attach ports and networks to policies,
please note that policy access is checked in the QoSPolicy neutron

commit_message:
Fix tenant access to qos policies

fix policy.json to not allow tenants to create policies or rules
by default and allow tenants attach ports and networks to policies,
please note that policy access is checked in the QoSPolicy neutron
object in such case.

Closes-Bug: #1485858

Change-Id: Ide1cd30979f99612fe89dddf3dc0e029d3f4d34a

subject: Do not put empty default_volume_type into config
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7128, 'name': 'Mark Vanderwiel', 'email': 'vanderwl@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kramvan'}, {'_account_id': 11915, 'name': 'Jan Klare', 'email': 'jan@bisdn.de', 'username': 'jklare'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 13:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['spec/cinder_common_spec.rb', 'templates/default/cinder.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Do not put empty default_volume_type into config

Change I1bb94dc1283e50645e4aece600acc52ae17db56b added the config option
default_volume_type with a default value of nil. With this, cinder fails
to create volumes unless a type is explicitly specified. So better only
write this value into the config file if it is set to some non-nil
value.

Change-Id: I7de8c6cc5a424b5b5021675d89a5dba71d72dce0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not put empty default_volume_type into config

Change I1bb94dc1283e50645e4aece600acc52ae17db56b added the config option
default_volume_type with a default value of nil. With this, cinder fails
to create volumes unless a type is explicitly specified. So better only
write this value into the config file if it is set to some non-nil
value.

Change-Id: I7de8c6cc5a424b5b5021675d89a5dba71d72dce0

commit_message:
Move the v2 api_sample functional tests

This patch move the all v2.1 api sample tests under
'functional/api_sample_tests'. Also move sample files under
'doc/api-samples'.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Partial-Bug: #1462901

commit_message:
Remove last of the plugins/v3 from unit tests

This is part of the v3 cleanup effort. The last remaining files in the
n/t/u/a/o/c/plugins/v3 directory have been moved to the base directory,
and all references to them have been updated to reflect the new paths.

Partial-Bug: #1462901

commit_message:
Initial msync run for all Puppet OpenStack modules

This patch is the initial modulesync run, it impact:

* gitignore: just a sync between projects
* gemfile:
  - update and allow to setup facter version and gem source
  - split beaker gems with a dedicated group
  - switch to rspec-puppet 2.2.0
* rakefile:
  - use the new syntax for lint configuration
  - add a acceptance target
* acceptance:
  - sync nodesets
* spec: added rspec coverage report

Change-Id: I34e999a752667d5f85266bc64059d9740ccbc367

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-14 09:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/http.py'], 'message': 'Pass context through http backend

In some use cases, The http backend should get and pass the auth-token
information in the context. And it should ensure that the auth-token is
safe encode. For example, if user try to get images from other glance
instances, they will need the auth-token. So we should pass context if
needed.

Closes-bug: #1482517
Change-Id: Ie628d66beb0da33ae8696449e0ba778ff1204567
'}]
commit_message:
Pass context through http backend

In some use cases, The http backend should get and pass the auth-token
information in the context. And it should ensure that the auth-token is
safe encode. For example, if user try to get images from other glance
instances, they will need the auth-token. So we should pass context if
needed.

Closes-bug: #1482517
Change-Id: Ie628d66beb0da33ae8696449e0ba778ff1204567

commit_message:
Initial msync run for all Puppet OpenStack modules

This patch is the initial modulesync run, it impacts:

* gitignore: just a sync between projects
* gemfile:
  - update and allow to setup facter version and gem source
  - split beaker gems with a dedicated group
  - switch to rspec-puppet 2.2.0
* rakefile:
  - use the new syntax for lint configuration
  - add a acceptance target
* acceptance:
  - sync nodesets
* spec: added rspec coverage report

commit_message:
use full length APT key

This is to make newer APT module versions happy. Without this change,
it always complains 'The id should be a full fingerprint (40
characters), see README.'

Change-Id: I271bed669e0ff7ba05928ac441cd20a0cab5fd4b

commit_message:
Move auto_assign_nic to class method

Moving logic of auto_assign_nic to class function is to help re-use it
in _boot_servers (it is used in _boot_server only now).

Change-Id: I22e80757b2394fcec63a55da6bee291d3b8fd573
Partial-Bug: #1477583

commit_message:
Treat return value of sdk function call as object

Although we can refer the return value of sdk function call as
both object and dictionary, we should unify our usage. This patch
fixes related issues in lbaas driver.

Change-Id: I09c57af6cd229a1609ddf87d97b6fc8dc940fe0f

commit_message:
Initial msync run for all Puppet OpenStack modules

This patch is the initial modulesync run, it impacts:

* gitignore: just a sync between projects
* gemfile:
  - update and allow to setup facter version and gem source
  - split beaker gems with a dedicated group
  - switch to rspec-puppet 2.2.0
* rakefile:
  - use the new syntax for lint configuration
  - add a acceptance target
* acceptance:
  - sync nodesets
* spec:
  - added rspec coverage report
  - added shared_example rspec helper
* lint: cleans up any lint errors caused by this sync up with msync

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 04:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/servers_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/test_live_block_migration_negative.py'], 'message': 'Make live_migrate_server use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes live_migrate_server use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I4371de93c40176e92d605fed352743c6a3e04fd7

commit_message:
Make live_migrate_server use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes live_migrate_server use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I4371de93c40176e92d605fed352743c6a3e04fd7

commit_message:
Remove "rebuild" parameter in migrate_server

the value of "rebuild" paremeter in migration_server is always
"False" and is never changed in any place.
And Rebuild is another function,so "rebuild" here could be removed.

Change-Id: I6149c42e0638560f44544ca257aa955cbb64a5a7

commit_message:
Change response of boot servers

Boot servers accepts "min_count" and "max_count" parameters, which allows to
create N servers in one API call. In any case, Nova API returns information
about 1 server.

This patch changes response object to return information about all created
servers.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I9943dd51effd60ca88cb73805ee27a8a1f0c54c5

commit_message:
Fix HNAS iSCSI 32 targets limitation error

When attaching more than 32 targets to an HNAS iSCSI backend, the
storage returns an error as there's a limitation on the number of
volumes that can be attached to a target. This patch fixes the
problem and creates new targets as needed.

Closes-Bug: #1479072
Change-Id: Id29259024b003a65cc80dfe63cac1c2d26f36059

commit_message:
CLI: Clone CG

This patch adds support for clone CG in cinderclient. It uses the
existing create CG from source command and adds an existing CG as a
source, in addition to a CG snapshot.

The server side patch is merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203473/

Change-Id: I2a923de42348c22c6ae5ff5880cdbe6d719ea0ae
Partial-implements: blueprint clone-cg

commit_message:
DVR: fix router rescheduling on agent side

The patch makes L3 agent aware of possible SNAT role
rescheduling to/from it.
The gist is to compare gw_port host change.
If it was changed and agent is not on target host then
it needs to clear snat namespace if one exists. If agent
is on target host it needs to create snat namespace from
scratch if it doesn't exist.

Host field was excluded from gw_port comparison on
agent side as part of HA Router feature implementation.
This code was moved to corresponding module.

Closes-Bug: #1472205
Change-Id: I840bded9eb547df014c6fb2b4cbfe4a876b9b878

commit_message:
Revert "Add the swap and ephemeral BDMs if needed"

This reverts commit 7f8128f87f5a2fa93c857295fb7e4163986eda25.

We are still reverting this commit in tripleo-ci, a simple revert now conflicts
so we need to stage a revert somewhere so CI can use it.

Change-Id: Ie8ab2b1d30451a0e34e16c1f47e6f33ca0bd71f2

commit_message:
Fix TypeError when doing cluster-scale-in

When trying to scale-in a cluster without configuring
'count' option, TypeError will happen. This is because
'count' is not the key of 'params'.

Closes-Bug: #1485820
Change-Id: I753bf2f9234910271254e6a60110b98a3d9994c7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-17 15:47:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Don't return Exception when volume is detached

This patch changes the way we handle volume detach
attempts when the attachment_id is already detached
and/or when the volume has no attachments.  We now
handle this the same way we do with deleting volumes
that don't exist.  We return success.

This patch also takes care to make sure we safely reset
the volume status to what it should be depending on if
there are other attachments.  If the attachment_id is
passed in and that attachment is detached, but there are
other attachments, we want to make sure that the volume is
left in an in-use state, not available.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/test_volume.py
        cinder/volume/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to commit
386e2858a4e76fafc1d78737154859a3c1618b20 not being in stable/kilo
and I don't plan on backporting that since it's based on the level
of oslo.log used in Liberty. This does mean the info messages in
the detach_volume method in the volume manager are not exactly
the same as what is in the original change in Liberty. Rather than
using the resource=volume kwarg, we just log the volume_id like the
error messages were before this change.

Change-Id: I11b7c45bb6570ce11e13e487cf1136ca2551036b
Closes-Bug: #1484194
Related-Bug: #1476806
(cherry picked from commit 3b4e8c31a2c94cac3e1a5c071eb38c7d5cb9a239)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't return Exception when volume is detached

This patch changes the way we handle volume detach
attempts when the attachment_id is already detached
and/or when the volume has no attachments.  We now
handle this the same way we do with deleting volumes
that don't exist.  We return success.

This patch also takes care to make sure we safely reset
the volume status to what it should be depending on if
there are other attachments.  If the attachment_id is
passed in and that attachment is detached, but there are
other attachments, we want to make sure that the volume is
left in an in-use state, not available.

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/test_volume.py
        cinder/volume/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to commit
386e2858a4e76fafc1d78737154859a3c1618b20 not being in stable/kilo
and I don't plan on backporting that since it's based on the level
of oslo.log used in Liberty. This does mean the info messages in
the detach_volume method in the volume manager are not exactly
the same as what is in the original change in Liberty. Rather than
using the resource=volume kwarg, we just log the volume_id like the
error messages were before this change.

Change-Id: I11b7c45bb6570ce11e13e487cf1136ca2551036b
Closes-Bug: #1484194
Related-Bug: #1476806
(cherry picked from commit 3b4e8c31a2c94cac3e1a5c071eb38c7d5cb9a239)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-17 11:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Update hypervisor stats in booting failed case

This fix is to perform correct updation of hypervisor available
resources in scenario when instance is present in nova db but already
released resources and not present in hypervsor db. For example, if
instance deployment fails on ironic callback-timeout,resource tracker
will abort all instance claims, tracker.abort_instance_claim and also
'Destroy' is called from ironic driver for this instance.Compute
manager sync nova db and hypervisor db periodically using
_sync_power_states. In this same call flow handling is added for
identifying these type of instances and skipped from accounting in
'update_available_resources' along with deleted ones.

Change-Id: I3968b5a6dd9c0f56936f1c1c661e8524a63534c3
Closes-Bug: #1446449
"}]
commit_message:
Update hypervisor stats in booting failed case

This fix is to perform correct updation of hypervisor available
resources in scenario when instance is present in nova db but already
released resources and not present in hypervsor db. For example, if
instance deployment fails on ironic callback-timeout,resource tracker
will abort all instance claims, tracker.abort_instance_claim and also
'Destroy' is called from ironic driver for this instance.Compute
manager sync nova db and hypervisor db periodically using
_sync_power_states. In this same call flow handling is added for
identifying these type of instances and skipped from accounting in
'update_available_resources' along with deleted ones.

Change-Id: I3968b5a6dd9c0f56936f1c1c661e8524a63534c3
Closes-Bug: #1446449

commit_message:
Add support '--all-tenants' for cinder backup-list

Cinder backup-list doesn't support '--all-tenants' argument for admin.
So it is always listing all tenants's backups for admin not only admin's
tenant. This patch fixes it.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1435158
Related-Bug: #1422046

Change-Id: I73f6377c7d6fd92d0464d13f9c8dd6682fef78e3

Move legacy v2 api smaple tests

This patch moves legacy v2 api sample tests under
'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/legacy_v2'

Also create new API sample test base class for matching new
path in 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/legacy_v2/ -
api_samples_test_base.py'

commit_message:
Change and move the workers options to corresponding service section

Currently, the workers options of collector, api and notification services
are all located in [DEFAULT] section. This change unify the options name
and move them to corresponding service configure section.
Additionally, this change will remove the "workers set by cpu number"
functionality, because it has no effect if the workers options has default
value.

Closes-Bug: #1481254

Change-Id: Idde86762ab6520d3adcbdd2b86d0f4de3a8517cd

commit_message:
Adding timeout to verify_metadata method in test_server_basicops

Sometimes the test_server_basicops test may fail with the following
traceback http://paste.openstack.org/show/412497/. The reason of this
failure is that the floating IP doesn't appear in
http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/public-ipv4 immediately and
we should check metadata within some timeout, not only once.

Closes-Bug: #1483585

Change-Id: I2f3d5d153cc67fefe048c80304d5477072660e7b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-14 20:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/simple_tenant_usage.py'], 'message': "Load flavor when getting instances for simple-tenant-usage

Per commit a6ff9efda33f4e465d5639618da1e2e2105890b6 which removes the
flavor compatibility code for system_metadata we no longer need to load
system_metadata when getting instances in the simple-tenant-usage API.
Instead we should expect the flavor attribute to be loaded when getting
the instances.

This updates the tests a bit since we no longer rely on system_metadata
so we have to mock out the instance.flavor instead.  There were a few
tests that relied on how instance.get_flavor() used to work with
system_metadata and since that's not really valid anymore, we change
those tests to just raise a NotFound from instance.get_flavor() if we're
testing some other lookup path.  As a result, two of the tests became
basically the same so one was removed.

Closes-Bug: #1485025

Change-Id: Ie6b3c470619bd67871b49e75af8044f173bed615
"}]
commit_message:
Load flavor when getting instances for simple-tenant-usage

Per commit a6ff9efda33f4e465d5639618da1e2e2105890b6 which removes the
flavor compatibility code for system_metadata we no longer need to load
system_metadata when getting instances in the simple-tenant-usage API.
Instead we should expect the flavor attribute to be loaded when getting
the instances.

This updates the tests a bit since we no longer rely on system_metadata
so we have to mock out the instance.flavor instead.  There were a few
tests that relied on how instance.get_flavor() used to work with
system_metadata and since that's not really valid anymore, we change
those tests to just raise a NotFound from instance.get_flavor() if we're
testing some other lookup path.  As a result, two of the tests became
basically the same so one was removed.

Closes-Bug: #1485025

Change-Id: Ie6b3c470619bd67871b49e75af8044f173bed615

commit_message:
Allow CPU/RAM overcommit when using NUMATopologyFilter

When using the NUMATopologyFilter, it doesn't make sense to entirely
prevent overcommit just because NUMA is involved.

This removes an overzealous check so that we still allow CPU and RAM
to be overcommitted even when NUMA is in play

Partial-Bug: #1484742
Change-Id: I896f67a25f6673dbebf46fd07e6fce8f1c2208c3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 20:15:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Fix docs translation import errors

When building docs, there are a ton of errors in this format:

AppRegistryNotReady: The translation infrastructure cannot be
initialized before the apps registry is ready. Check that you don't make
non-lazy gettext calls at import time.

Starting in Django 1.7, standalone scripts, such as a sphinx build
require that django.setup() be called first. See:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/releases/1.7/#standalone-scripts

This should be added to the horizon/docs/source/conf.py

Doing so eliminates the errors.

Closes-Bug: #1486139
Change-Id: I0871be3d60d4d78cb430fabdb5725832559191d7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix docs translation import errors

When building docs, there are a ton of errors in this format:

AppRegistryNotReady: The translation infrastructure cannot be
initialized before the apps registry is ready. Check that you don't make
non-lazy gettext calls at import time.

Starting in Django 1.7, standalone scripts, such as a sphinx build
require that django.setup() be called first. See:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/releases/1.7/#standalone-scripts

This should be added to the horizon/docs/source/conf.py

Doing so eliminates the errors.

Closes-Bug: #1486139
Change-Id: I0871be3d60d4d78cb430fabdb5725832559191d7

commit_message:
Ironic: Create nodes with names

This patch is setting a name for each node created in Ironic, when
testing stuff it's easier to refer to a nome by its name then uuid.

The format of the name is: node-0, node-1, ...

Change-Id: I60fcddbcb36d1b1da8b3846b6edf14c59401f102

commit_message:
jenkins/puppet: add missing builders to integration job

To be consistent with Beaker jobs, we need to enabling local root access
and clean the node of any previous Puppet install.

That means adding 2 builders that are already used by other Puppet jobs:
* puppet-prepare-node
* allow-local-ssh-root

Change-Id: Ib1a006fbbe5252c3642187d7be4f857134cc7558

commit_message:
Use the executor directly in notifier

Instead of going through taskflow, use the executor directly in the
notifier, so that task execution doesn't block the pipeline and the main
loop when running.

Once the instance cache file is built, we can never refresh the
cache because we get a TypeError trying to build the dimensions
and mis-diagnose the VM as a ghost VM.  Simple fix is to move

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin bug for newly created VMs

Once the instance cache file is built, we can never refresh the
cache because we get a TypeError trying to build the dimensions
and mis-diagnose the VM as a ghost VM.  Simple fix is to move
the update cache call above where we look for the instance name
in the cache.

Change-Id: Iddc229a4e0f150e838a82ace36bc1ba92be17a0e
Closes-Bug: #1486688

commit_message:
l3_odl: put request for remove_interface, not delete

remove_interface requires PUT method, not DELETE method.
Thus remove_interface results in internal server error.

Closes-Bug: #1485800
Change-Id: I9c1b6efc8343cc5256dcaa7a35c5c9771fa98479

When using the servicegroup DB driver, whether or not the service
is up is now determined by the "last_seen_up" field, not the
"updated_at" field.  Exposing the "last_seen_up" field will make
it clear why the service is considered "down".

DocImpact
APIImpact
When the DB servicegroup driver is used and the compute node has
reported its state at least once, and the client asks for the
appropriate API microversion, this will result in a new
"last_seen_up" property being added to the information for that
compute node when issuing a GET on /v2/{tenant-id}/os-services

Implements blueprint expose-last-seen-up-listing-services

Change-Id: I2294dfb54c18afeeddfcea755d64e1e1fad2c23d
'}]
commit_message:
Conditionally expose "last_seen_up" in service list

When using the servicegroup DB driver, whether or not the service
is up is now determined by the "last_seen_up" field, not the
"updated_at" field.  Exposing the "last_seen_up" field will make
it clear why the service is considered "down".

DocImpact
APIImpact
When the DB servicegroup driver is used and the compute node has
reported its state at least once, and the client asks for the
appropriate API microversion, this will result in a new
"last_seen_up" property being added to the information for that
compute node when issuing a GET on /v2/{tenant-id}/os-services

Implements blueprint expose-last-seen-up-listing-services

Related-Bug: #1420848
Change-Id: I2294dfb54c18afeeddfcea755d64e1e1fad2c23d

commit_message:
[network-guide] Update L3 HA scenarios

Update L3 HA scenarios as follows:

1) Rename scenario files and adjust titles accordingly.
2) Add HA project network to diagrams.
3) Update diagrams to improve consistency and clarity.
4) Clarify failover process content.
5) Add step to launch an example instance.
6) Add validation steps for floating IP address.
7) Replace tenant with project.

Closes-Bug: #1465778
Partial-Bug: #1465783
Change-Id: Ieeb2726301dab45876cca3e2161c6230af232bcb

commit_message:
Implement SoftwareComponent and WebApplication normative types

Add support for translating TOSCA normative types
tosca.nodes.SoftwareComponent and tosca.nodes.WebApplication
and added unit tests for them.

Change-Id: I4b2bf955b5ca5181fc0021cd5633722cd449fbc6
Closes-Bug: #1479132

subject: Don't force package upgrades when running tox
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14084, 'name': 'Einst Crazy', 'email': 'yu.changcai@99cloud.net', 'username': 'Einst'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-17 12:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't force package upgrades when running tox

This essentially reverts change
If5c4e12956f2c7be6530c5c9a57fdfb1da8e710c .

Currently, tox.ini contains the line:

install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

This causes a serious headscratcher for anybody running:

  tox --sitepackages

In the above case, the user intends to test in a virtualenv using
system packages where available. However, this setting prevents this
from working, as it will force upgrade them anyway.

The justification for the original commit includes 'this ensures that
the latest packages are installed'. This isn't correct behaviour. If a
particular version of a package is insufficient, the correct solution
is to bump its version requirement in requirements.txt.

The other justification was that the latest oslo packages should be
used. Tox should not be using system packages at all if 'sitepackages'
has not been set, so this should not be a consideration. i.e. Somebody
running 'tox --sitepackages' where oslo packages are installed would
expect the site packages to be used, but currently they are not.
Somebody running tox without '--sitepackages' would expect a new
package to be pulled down, which should have been the case without the
above change, anyway.

Change-Id: I5a47ddb9f8a67ceb1904cbc24e2a61f04d1ba1de
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force package upgrades when running tox

This essentially reverts change
If5c4e12956f2c7be6530c5c9a57fdfb1da8e710c .

Currently, tox.ini contains the line:

install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}

This causes a serious headscratcher for anybody running:

  tox --sitepackages

In the above case, the user intends to test in a virtualenv using
system packages where available. However, this setting prevents this
from working, as it will force upgrade them anyway.

The justification for the original commit includes 'this ensures that
the latest packages are installed'. This isn't correct behaviour. If a
particular version of a package is insufficient, the correct solution
is to bump its version requirement in requirements.txt.

The other justification was that the latest oslo packages should be
used. Tox should not be using system packages at all if 'sitepackages'
has not been set, so this should not be a consideration. i.e. Somebody
running 'tox --sitepackages' where oslo packages are installed would
expect the site packages to be used, but currently they are not.
Somebody running tox without '--sitepackages' would expect a new
package to be pulled down, which should have been the case without the
above change, anyway.

Change-Id: I5a47ddb9f8a67ceb1904cbc24e2a61f04d1ba1de

place only for MySQL, however there is no corresponding
Index() object in the model such that autogenerate would

commit_message:
Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters

These two indexes are part of the Alembic migrations which take
place only for MySQL, however there is no corresponding
Index() object in the model such that autogenerate would
know that these aren't removed.  Ensure they are considered by
the include_object filter so that autogenerate does not
include that these seem to be removed.

(rebase)

Change-Id: I49abb3f7ad9731cde046fa2862cdb9ec16c3aeb3

commit_message:
Implement expand/contract autogenerate extension

Makes use of new Alembic 0.8 features to allow
altering of the "alembic revision" stream such
that operations for expand and contract are
directed into separate branches.

Change-Id: Ifa743e2f5b90e59a8de8f4e7a67c4bbe46686804

commit_message:
DVR: fix router scheduling

Fix scheduling of DVR routers to not stop scheduling once
csnat portion was scheduled. See bug report for failing
scenario.

This partially reverts
commit 3794b4a83e68041e24b715135f0ccf09a5631178
and fixes bug 1374473 by moving csnat scheduling
after general dvr router scheduling, so double binding does
not happen.

Closes-Bug: #1472163
Related-Bug: #1374473
Change-Id: I57c06e2be732e47b6cce7c724f6b255ea2d8fa32

commit_message:
Add the resp to RestClientExceptions

This gives us access to a resp attribute on any RestClientExceptions
raised during requests made by the RestClient

Change-Id: I79eace93e7080de64fa53399ba14ee131cd3a7ff

commit_message:
Make sure 'SubnetId' update works for instance

'SubnetId' is updatable property, but now the
update doesn't works if only update 'SubnetId'
without 'NetworkInterfaces'.

Change-Id: I86a9ce608ce13931a35d2776c6df0637bb022949
Closes-Bug: #1479650

commit_message:
Rename Manila context

Make Manila context named in the same way as all existing contexts - having
resource name in context name. Also move manila-related stuff from top of
'self.context' to appropriate subcatalogs.

Change-Id: I3e8e660151d6a4c119738681b65ce42e32bdddd4

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-10 12:07:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/notifications.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_notifications.py'], 'message': "Fix notify_decorator errors

* getattr is built-in function, so should not be used as attribute.
* When ctxt is None, rpc.get_notifier('api').info(ctxt, name, body)
  leads NoneType exception at context.to_dict(). So we need guarantee
  one valid context here.

Closes-Bug: #1476931

Change-Id: I25953467aca641448d25b2d63352f756ec3655aa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix notify_decorator errors

* getattr is built-in function, so should not be used as attribute.
* When ctxt is None, rpc.get_notifier('api').info(ctxt, name, body)
  leads NoneType exception at context.to_dict(). So we need guarantee
  one valid context here.

Closes-Bug: #1476931

Change-Id: I25953467aca641448d25b2d63352f756ec3655aa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}]

Recent changes have removed exiting test coverage for nova client
call to discover and load the extensions. This patch adds
them back.

Also changes aws/test_loadbalancer.py to fix

Co-Authored-By: Tony Wang <muyu@unitedstack.com>

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for nova client plugin

Recent changes have removed exiting test coverage for nova client
call to discover and load the extensions. This patch adds
them back.

Also changes aws/test_loadbalancer.py to fix
bug #1482153.

Co-Authored-By: Tony Wang <muyu@unitedstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavlo Shchelokovskyy <pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5130bfe09073e995413779af216b4dfb2a859e4f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-13 19:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': "neutron: filter None port_ids from ports list in _unbind_ports

The compute manager calls deallocate_for_instance with the original
requested_networks when an instance fails to build and we try to
cleanup. The port_id in the requested_networks tuple is optional, so we
can end up passing a list of ports to _unbind_ports with None in it,
which will result in a 404 back from neutron since a port with id None
does not exist. This doesn't fail the operation but it results in an
ugly stacktrace in the compute logs.

This change simply checks for None in _unbind_ports when iterating over
the list of ports passed in.

Note that the filtering could be done in deallocate_for_instance when
building the ports_to_skip list from requested_networks, but I opted to
future proof the _unbind_ports method in case other callers forget to
filter the list passed in, and there are other callers of _unbind_ports.

Closes-Bug: #1478702

Change-Id: Ie5980be71a1d83f03ab5d232f29da7e67caf6f35"}]
commit_message:
neutron: filter None port_ids from ports list in _unbind_ports

The compute manager calls deallocate_for_instance with the original
requested_networks when an instance fails to build and we try to
cleanup. The port_id in the requested_networks tuple is optional, so we
can end up passing a list of ports to _unbind_ports with None in it,
which will result in a 404 back from neutron since a port with id None
does not exist. This doesn't fail the operation but it results in an
ugly stacktrace in the compute logs.

This change simply checks for None in _unbind_ports when iterating over
the list of ports passed in.

Note that the filtering could be done in deallocate_for_instance when
building the ports_to_skip list from requested_networks, but I opted to
future proof the _unbind_ports method in case other callers forget to
filter the list passed in, and there are other callers of _unbind_ports.

Closes-Bug: #1478702

Change-Id: Ie5980be71a1d83f03ab5d232f29da7e67caf6f35

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-13 18:09:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Raise error when booting from encrypted volumes

Currently, booting from an encrypted volume which contains
a whole image fails without alerting the end user to the
failure. Booting from an encrypted volume which contains a
multi-part image causes Nova to stream the image to a file
cache in the clear, essentially negating the security
benefits of the encryption. Therefore, this patch simply
prevents the user from booting from an encrypted volume and
logs an error message describing the failure.

Closes-bug: #1465656
Change-Id: I18baf6f16dc92f34f6a0b08ffff0b935e2f97c6d
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Raise error when booting from encrypted volumes

Currently, booting from an encrypted volume which contains
a whole image fails without alerting the end user to the
failure. Booting from an encrypted volume which contains a
multi-part image causes Nova to stream the image to a file
cache in the clear, essentially negating the security
benefits of the encryption. Therefore, this patch simply
prevents the user from booting from an encrypted volume and
logs an error message describing the failure.

Closes-bug: #1465656
Change-Id: I18baf6f16dc92f34f6a0b08ffff0b935e2f97c6d

commit_message:
Fix deleted markers with changed-since

When changed-since is passed, it's possible to have pagination markers
that resolve to a deleted instance. A request to this marker fails
because the query is not reading deleted instances. Fix this.

Change-Id: I5b6075a9a952ce4053a481e83e1497fb8faf6ecb

commit_message:
VMware: treat deletion exception with attached volumes

Enable the OpenStack user to successfully delete an instance that was
running on an ESX that has been removed, or the instance was deleted from
the backend VC. In the event that the instance would have an attached
volume then deleting the instance would not handle the exception
ManagedObjectNotFound.

Change-Id: I1781256bec15ed3301425e63c7a3d28dc057f83e
Closes-bug: #1471751

commit_message:
VMware: ensure that get_info raises the correct exception

In the event that a instance is deleted during the get_info method
then the method would not raise the correct exception.

If the instance no longer exists then the VC will raise
a 'ManagedObjectNotFound' exception.

Note that the oslo.vmware patch that supports this exception is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191553/

This exception handling is treated by using vexc.register_fault_class
to support the local exception (until replaced by oslo.vmware)

Co-Authored-By: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I2d4b131789319cfd1322cbc95edd7822114532e1
Closes-bug: #1464979

commit_message:
Add ubuntu-trusty node to os-ansible-deployment

This patch adds an ubuntu-trusty node-based non-voting
check to os-ansible-deployment to help determine whether
the differing images between hpcloud and raxcloud are
contributing to the gate check failures seen solely in
hpcloud.

The idea is to use the exact same image across both
clouds to see the results.

Change-Id: I7809e3f4b3012586f4aaa0de9d9bc7b0011e720d

commit_message:
Commonize config usage for base test classes

Derive DbTestCase from BaseTestClass to use config fixture as a
preffered way for such things. Initialize full set of config options for
all tests.

This leaded to some reworking of db initialization in DBTestCase.

Change-Id: Ibec8406f141a74c6f42f6c9d502ced0008ae0214

commit_message:
Return volume name from backup_restore

Currently volume id and backup id are returned, the change is
to return volume_name also, which is consistent in style with
cinder backup-create.

The related change in python-cinderclient is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199846/

APIImpact
It will return additional info "volume_name": volume name when
restoring backup.

Change-Id: I9f5d8ded993fcf1d351d4c65b6806929693b15d6
Closes-Bug: #1472493

commit_message:
Fix attribute error with old glance backend

Glance (<= Havana) does not provide the virtual_size attribute for
images. So we first check if it is available to achieve compatibility
with older Glance versions.

Closes-Bug: #1482657
Change-Id: Iabacb5380e6ad5fa0a2e6749c09072f303cb222d
(cherry picked from commit a8c0c4b2bddb5f65f67f311e0193617c87b93f1d)

subject: pep8: Don't format using self.__dict__
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-16 08:41:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/swob.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'pep8: Don't format using self.__dict__

Fix the warning "H501  Do not use self.__dict__ for string formatting"
in swob.py.

In practice, it looks like only self.drive is used in self.__dict__:
RESPONSE_REASONS 507: ('Insufficient Storage', 'There was not enough
space to save the resource. Drive: %(drive)s').

test.unit.common.test_swob checks the HTTP exceptions are correctly
formatted. The test test_507() ensures that the error message contains
the drive name "sda1", the test uses the exception:
HTTPInsufficientStorage(drive='sda1').

Change-Id: I8a91a73b07dfadf5f6b723bc6e6c5785ff60d3c6
'}]
commit_message:
pep8: Don't format using self.__dict__

Fix the warning "H501  Do not use self.__dict__ for string formatting"
in swob.py.

In practice, it looks like only self.drive is used in self.__dict__:
RESPONSE_REASONS 507: ('Insufficient Storage', 'There was not enough
space to save the resource. Drive: %(drive)s').

test.unit.common.test_swob checks the HTTP exceptions are correctly
formatted. The test test_507() ensures that the error message contains
the drive name "sda1", the test uses the exception:
HTTPInsufficientStorage(drive='sda1').

Change-Id: I8a91a73b07dfadf5f6b723bc6e6c5785ff60d3c6

commit_message:
Add nonvoting beaker tests to infra/puppet-accessbot

This is the first step towards adding them to all pupept modules.
The tests were already enabled but nonvoting on zuul so this moves the
zuul to the new syntax.

Change-Id: Iff1f0b4d86dfb026cec5ffef9a3e07576017e0bc

As for volume-backed instance, the root volume doesn't

commit_message:
Allow resize root_gb to 0 for volume-backed instances

Currently, after an instance launched with bootable
volume and flavor with non-zero disk. If we resize
this instance to an flavor with zero disk, Nova API
will throw exception.

As for volume-backed instance, the root volume doesn't
occupy any space in nova-compute node. So it should not
be limited by flavor's root_gb.

Change-Id: I1ab1a2625650a828b94c0af2147b0aa53a652a82
Closes-Bug: 1480040

commit_message:
Retry check for path existence after delay if needed

Trying to perform file injection without libguestfs, i.e. fallback
to nbd device. Although the commands to create device  succeed
the check for file path generates an error.
Inserting a short sleep before rechecking addresses this issue

Change-Id: I127ac1bf8b640ede38e947c6ff64ce2ee6cc2d8d
Closes-Bug: 1484586

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-13 14:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Limit parallel live migrations in progress

This patch extends the previous one[1] to allow limiting the total number of parallel
builds that nova-compute will attempt to cover live migrations. Since we can now
block immediately on the semaphore, this also implements the behavior we have in
build, which spawns a new thread for the process so that we don't starve our
RPC workers waiting on the semaphore. In reality, live migrations take a long time,
so this was something we should have already had.

Further, as soon as we receive the request to do the live migration, we mark the
migration object as status='queued' to indicate that it's waiting for its turn
on the compute node. Once we're given a slot to run, the normal status='preparing'
will be set. This will allow an operator to monitor the status of queued and
running migrations.

This includes a change to the libvirt driver to avoid spawning another thread
for the live migrations process. That makes it synchronous from the perspective
of compute manager, and in line with all the other drivers that support the
operation. Since compute manager now spawns the thread, libvirt is unaffected
and the other drivers avoid potentially starving the RPC worker pool as well.

[1] Commit 5a542e770648469b0fbb638f6ba53f95424252ec

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable to limit parallel live migrations.
           Zero means "unlimited" and nonzero means "this many in parallel".

Closes-Bug: #1478108
Change-Id: Ia8a796372746b7fc75485dc2e663f270dbd5893a
'}]
commit_message:
Limit parallel live migrations in progress

This patch extends the previous one[1] to allow limiting the total number of parallel
builds that nova-compute will attempt to cover live migrations. Since we can now
block immediately on the semaphore, this also implements the behavior we have in
build, which spawns a new thread for the process so that we don't starve our
RPC workers waiting on the semaphore. In reality, live migrations take a long time,
so this was something we should have already had.

Further, as soon as we receive the request to do the live migration, we mark the
migration object as status='queued' to indicate that it's waiting for its turn
on the compute node. Once we're given a slot to run, the normal status='preparing'
will be set. This will allow an operator to monitor the status of queued and
running migrations.

This includes a change to the libvirt driver to avoid spawning another thread
for the live migrations process. That makes it synchronous from the perspective
of compute manager, and in line with all the other drivers that support the
operation. Since compute manager now spawns the thread, libvirt is unaffected
and the other drivers avoid potentially starving the RPC worker pool as well.

[1] Commit 5a542e770648469b0fbb638f6ba53f95424252ec

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable to limit parallel live migrations.
           Zero means "unlimited" and nonzero means "this many in parallel".

Closes-Bug: #1478108
Change-Id: Ia8a796372746b7fc75485dc2e663f270dbd5893a

commit_message:
VMware: map one nova-compute to one VC cluster

This patch changes the VMware VC driver to manage only one compute node
which is a vCenter cluster. The support for multiple nodes was
deprecated in the Kilo release with commit
dcd33757dbcfee3c9a0e623f04a722c91de7ed0c and now it is time to be
completely removed.

DocImpact
The 'cluster_name' property is a single string and multiple values are
no longer accepted.

Change-Id: Ifc17c5049e3ed29c8dd130339207907b00433960

commit_message:
Simplify interface for creating snapshot of volume-backed instance

Initialize new image metadata inside the creation method instead of
outside it. This reduce code duplication.

Also this fixes snapshot creation in EC2, since it had bugs in image
metadata initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1439820
Change-Id: If3efa2a274517a9ad51d5dfff0134ae9e8e702a4

subject: nailgun::ngnix: rate limit /bootstrap traffic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-05 17:05:58.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/nginx-repo.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/examples/nginx-only.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/templates/nginx_nailgun_repo.conf.erb', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/nginx.pp'], 'message': 'nailgun::ngnix: rate limit /bootstrap traffic

Bootstrap nodes download their root filesystem image via HTTP.
HTTP traffic disrupts DHCP (and TFTP) one due to excessive re-transmissions,
As a result PXE firmware might fail to obtain IP address due to a timeout.
Thus about a half of 200 nodes fail to boot. To work around the problem
rate limit HTTP traffic (per a client) so the collisions rate is reasonably
small and UDP based protocols can work properly.

As a downside downloading root filesystem image of a bootstrap node takes
at least 40 seconds now. For small setups this might be too restrictive,
so limit can be adjusted via BOOTSTRAP/limit_rate parameter in astute.yaml.
Setting the value to zero removes the limit.

Closes-Bug: #1481721

Change-Id: Ib648bba065f78faee15d2d03dc35c390a6570a6b
'}]
commit_message:
nailgun::ngnix: rate limit /bootstrap traffic

Bootstrap nodes download their root filesystem image via HTTP.
HTTP traffic disrupts DHCP (and TFTP) one due to excessive re-transmissions,
As a result PXE firmware might fail to obtain IP address due to a timeout.
Thus about a half of 200 nodes fail to boot. To work around the problem
rate limit HTTP traffic (per a client) so the collisions rate is reasonably
small and UDP based protocols can work properly.

As a downside downloading root filesystem image of a bootstrap node takes
at least 40 seconds now. For small setups this might be too restrictive,
so limit can be adjusted via BOOTSTRAP/limit_rate parameter in astute.yaml.
Setting the value to zero removes the limit.

Closes-Bug: #1481721

Change-Id: Ib648bba065f78faee15d2d03dc35c390a6570a6b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-16 19:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'message': 'Unmount the ephemeral drive before running tests

Some tests (like those run by d-g) expect the ephemeral drive to be
unmounted otherwise they will refuse to format it and fail. As part of
marking the node ready unmount the ephemeral drive if necessary.

Change-Id: Id3eebe3b12e4751ded43b9a99587a5d9b8f9e9ba
'}]
commit_message:
Unmount the ephemeral drive before running tests

Some tests (like those run by d-g) expect the ephemeral drive to be
unmounted otherwise they will refuse to format it and fail. As part of
marking the node ready unmount the ephemeral drive if necessary.

Change-Id: Id3eebe3b12e4751ded43b9a99587a5d9b8f9e9ba

commit_message:
Validate quota class_name

If you pass class name with more than 255 characters to
quota-class-update api, then it returns 500 error code.

Added a check to validate string limit and returned 400 if
limit exceeds.

Closes-Bug: #1463396
Change-Id: I1bb924679ee41f48933b86b5509700ab716507f7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 03:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py'], 'message': 'Fix message missing after duplicated message error

Message will not be handle after acknowledge failure, but it will store
in cache to prohibit handle duplicate message by skipping it.
So a message can be missed if client receive a duplicate message.

Fix this problem by store the message info in cache after a successfuly
message acknowledgment.

Change-Id: I907a58199eeadac22c31490111ec51ee6dd874d5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix message missing after duplicated message error

Message will not be handle after acknowledge failure, but it will store
in cache to prohibit handle duplicate message by skipping it.
So a message can be missed if client receive a duplicate message.

Fix this problem by store the message info in cache after a successfuly
message acknowledgment.

Change-Id: I907a58199eeadac22c31490111ec51ee6dd874d5

commit_message:
Move V2.1 API unittest to top level directory

This patch moves the tests in contrib/ and plugins/v3/ into the
base directory.

Note that some of the tests have both v2 and v21 tests, The v2
tests will be deleted when V2 API removed.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>
Change-Id: I6ff1d6594e7a44f2bcb6bbb04a4277b98d1cac74
Partial-Bug: #1462901
