revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 21:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'message': 'Updated max_len configuration

A recent update to max_len permits setting the "tab handling"
property as a third parameter, telling eslint how to count a tab if
it is encountered. A different rule enforces spaces in our code, so
this is not strictly necessary, however for the sake of
safety this explicitly sets our tab handling to our indent rate: 2

Change-Id: I05a8167bca324ba14b4d29af44358c3ffe2f6c2e
'}]
commit_message:
Updated max_len configuration

A recent update to max_len permits setting the "tab handling"
property as a third parameter, telling eslint how to count a tab if
it is encountered. A different rule enforces spaces in our code, so
this is not strictly necessary, however for the sake of
safety this explicitly sets our tab handling to our indent rate: 2

Change-Id: I05a8167bca324ba14b4d29af44358c3ffe2f6c2e

commit_message:
Added SwitchCase to indent.

This additional rule will validate that case statements inside of
switch blocks are indented by x-times the normal indent. In this
case it is 1x the normal indent -> 2 spaces. The default is 0.

Change-Id: Ib79e859d1ec3aaafdc22c886a9c01030d5f913c7

commit_message:
Replace get_cinder_client_version in cinder.py

Due to bug 1386232 Nova has forked get_volume_api_from_url method from
python-cinderclient. As the bug is fixed now this commit removes Nova's
version and replaces usages with cinderclient's one.

Depends-On: Idce26be00db8551d265fe668975a5843c772dd65
Change-Id: Ib0043786c808b470078d65db0d874720f99e583e
Closes-Bug: 1465627

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-11 16:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_images.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/images.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Do not untar OVA on the file system

The OVA image is a tarball which consists of OVF descriptor and VMDKs.
Currently the OVA is unpacked on the file system and then uploaded on
the datastore. This is inefficient and may cause n-cpu to run out of
space if large images are booted.
This patch fixes this by processing the OVA image as a stream -- we
subsequently read chunks of data from Glance and upload them to
vCenter.

Change-Id: I22f5897da0870a1d69fa153a0868000369159b37
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Do not untar OVA on the file system

The OVA image is a tarball which consists of OVF descriptor and VMDKs.
Currently the OVA is unpacked on the file system and then uploaded on
the datastore. This is inefficient and may cause n-cpu to run out of
space if large images are booted.
This patch fixes this by processing the OVA image as a stream -- we
subsequently read chunks of data from Glance and upload them to
vCenter.

Change-Id: I22f5897da0870a1d69fa153a0868000369159b37

Currently, there is a hard coded value for the login url for the
dashboard in the tempest config. The root for dashboard needs to
be configurable in tempest as well. This patch allows construction
of the login url from information on the page and the hard-coded
url for the dashboard in the tempest config.

The main goal of this patch is a bridge between current use of '/'
and '/dashboard' for the horizon root in devstack. If desired, post
switch we can update the hardcoded value. And revert this patch.

Change-Id: I9a04f936ed6d8c14775a332dc28e903992806c42
"}]
commit_message:
allow non '/' root for dashboard

Currently, there is a hard coded value for the login url for the
dashboard in the tempest config. The root for dashboard needs to
be configurable in tempest as well. This patch allows construction
of the login url from information on the page and the hard-coded
url for the dashboard in the tempest config.

The main goal of this patch is a bridge between current use of '/'
and '/dashboard' for the horizon root in devstack. If desired, post
switch we can update the hardcoded value. And revert this patch.

Related change: I6fbca5cea9e44df160afbccc71bd045437657320

Change-Id: I9a04f936ed6d8c14775a332dc28e903992806c42

commit_message:
Location of the "local.conf" file is confusing. It is updated.

It was shown that the local.conf is at root devstack directory, but
it is at devstack/samples directory. So the path is updated.

1.) Copy the file into root Devstack directory.

Change-Id: I6ff8a404a3664c892bb458023c57ccc5d0926fdf
Closes-Bug: #1464491

commit_message:
Change cinder_volume_driver config option to enable_ceph

We are going to support two types of config - ceph or lvm. There's
no need for templating further support for cinder drivers. If
there is an interest for other drivers, operators can provide their
own overrides to the cinder config files.

Change-Id: I48d0d8eb5e5c81c3c00474f3932bd7f5b4642f5a
Closes-Bug: #1485704

commit_message:
Added list_projects non-admin test to identity/v3/test_projects

test_list_projects_returns_authorized_projects() test uses
non-admin user's token to make a request to list projects.
Test checks that user can see only that projects that he
was bound to.

Change-Id: Ia5a60c7022739293046b9341d95c3869da834c56

commit_message:
Removed special treatment for feature/qos branch

The feature is merged into master now, so we don't need the branch, and
we also don't need those hacks to enable QoS specific config knobs for
it.

Change-Id: I69f124cd39bbd2c7e3ac8b8f1040503ca9bd82f6
Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api

commit_message:
Make X-IO volume driver wait for delete volume to complete

Add a check to make sure the volume has been deleted from
the backend storage before returning from delete_volume.

Change-Id: Icc662de476fcb21ff2f7ca6aa69e46c434214d7e
Closes-Bug: #1482044

subject: Don't use ipv6 in ironic pxe jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 20:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Don't use ipv6 in ironic pxe jobs

The ironic pxe jobs fail tempest due to floating ip attachment issues.
The fix has been proposed to nova [1]. Until that fix gets in force
ironic pxe jobs to use ipv4 only. This will allow us to switch the other
tempest jobs to ipv4 + ipv6 by default.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168701/

Change-Id: I126da44dcf5f5cbbbab5f3814a3264aad8c06da6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use ipv6 in ironic pxe jobs

The ironic pxe jobs fail tempest due to floating ip attachment issues.
The fix has been proposed to nova [1]. Until that fix gets in force
ironic pxe jobs to use ipv4 only. This will allow us to switch the other
tempest jobs to ipv4 + ipv6 by default.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168701/

Change-Id: I126da44dcf5f5cbbbab5f3814a3264aad8c06da6

commit_message:
Make attach_volume use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes attach_volume use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ibc7f5c80755876318e1f5c7f7548276f315467c6

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-08-19 11:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/functional/hooks/post_test_hook.sh', 'neutronclient/tests/functional/hooks/gate_hook.sh'], 'message': 'Create hooks for running functional test

Create hook so that we can introduce a new job to test the VPN test cases
using the VPN devstack plugin, and run other test cases w/o the plugin
enabled.

I2db939bf99288c0cdec06cdd49fec3bdc72e5253 adds the ability to use a gate
hook and creates experimental jobs for both core and VPN tests, named
gate-neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional and
gate-neutronclient-dsvm-functional-vpn, respectively.

A follow-up commit will move the VPN test cases, and modify tox.ini to
support two jobs, one for VPN tests and one for other tests.

Change-Id: Ieeaca1375d68705509f4e05f10cb35c0fa0b9582
Partial-Bug: 1484148
'}]
commit_message:
Create hooks for running functional test

Create hook so that we can introduce a new job to test the VPN test cases
using the VPN devstack plugin, and run other test cases w/o the plugin
enabled.

I2db939bf99288c0cdec06cdd49fec3bdc72e5253 adds the ability to use a gate
hook and creates experimental jobs for both core and VPN tests, named
gate-neutronclient-test-dsvm-functional and
gate-neutronclient-dsvm-functional-vpn, respectively.

A follow-up commit will move the VPN test cases, and modify tox.ini to
support two jobs, one for VPN tests and one for other tests.

Change-Id: Ieeaca1375d68705509f4e05f10cb35c0fa0b9582
Partial-Bug: 1484148

commit_message:
Dedicate aggregates for specific tenants

Extend the "AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation" scheduler filter
in order to optionally exclude instances from being scheduled
for deployment in hosts that don't belong to the defined
aggregate(s). This behavior is defined by "exclusive_tenant_id"
metadata key.

Implements: blueprint multi-tenancy-isolation-only-aggregates
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ief5ab81bd0622ff54964fbc0de1110708d814add

subject: Enable log_slave_updates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-19 14:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/my.cnf.j2'], 'message': 'Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
(cherry picked from commit 41332ab35f5ff667cd5d3fdbecf03ffac0e87147)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
(cherry picked from commit 41332ab35f5ff667cd5d3fdbecf03ffac0e87147)

With keystone's move to /identity, a conflict in for resources was

This patch sets the root for horizon to /dashboard and serves all

commit_message:
Move horizon apache root to /dashboard

With keystone's move to /identity, a conflict in for resources was
created as both keystone and horizon used /identity. The keystone
config took precedence and rendered API output in the horizon UI.

This patch sets the root for horizon to /dashboard and serves all
horizon content from there. Additionally, a RedirectMatch has been added
to the apache config for horizon to redirect '/' to '/dashboard' this
will allow the implementation to change without being immediately
painful to users.

Also made the path '/dashboard/' configurable in stackrc.

Closes-Bug: #1478306
Depends-On: I9a04f936ed6d8c14775a332dc28e903992806c42

for devstack-gate changes to remove hard coded horizon url structure
assumptions.

Change-Id: I6fbca5cea9e44df160afbccc71bd045437657320

at this moment)in order to change their public/protected
attributes later

commit_message:
Use start status of coodinator in tooz

CoordinationDriver of tooz has maintained the status about coordinator
started or not. we don't need to re-define a _started in ceilometer.

Depends-on: I1a177cf3efd63593667751c6b53bcc536fb0670f

Change-Id: I8487275b419e355548ef9df6e7c8515f569f83bd

subject: Reduce openstack-ansible commit check timeout
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 09:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/os-ansible-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Reduce openstack-ansible commit check timeout

We're seeing issues on hpcloud build nodes where some checks run until
the full build timeout, but barely get anything done.

Examples:
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/10/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/c582f2f/
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/6/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/dc16799/
http://logs.openstack.org/74/194474/20/gate/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/cda0778/
http://logs.openstack.org/16/210516/2/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/6cf0e08/

This patch reduces the commit check timeout from 120m to 90m. Our
average successful build is at around 70 minutes, so this is a safe
build timeout and allows us to recheck appropriately in a more
timely fashion.

Change-Id: Ia4c0d73b62a6cf1bb5f255a786616ae494f95777
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce openstack-ansible commit check timeout

We're seeing issues on hpcloud build nodes where some checks run until
the full build timeout, but barely get anything done.

Examples:
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/10/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/c582f2f/
http://logs.openstack.org/92/210492/6/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/dc16799/
http://logs.openstack.org/74/194474/20/gate/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/cda0778/
http://logs.openstack.org/16/210516/2/check/gate-os-ansible-deployment-dsvm-commit/6cf0e08/

This patch reduces the commit check timeout from 120m to 90m. Our
average successful build is at around 70 minutes, so this is a safe
build timeout and allows us to recheck appropriately in a more
timely fashion.

Change-Id: Ia4c0d73b62a6cf1bb5f255a786616ae494f95777

commit_message:
Add base for IPA functional tests

Starts up an agent in a thread and then runs functional tests against
it.

Add the first functional test of the API: a simple test of the
commands API.

Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If4ad611929d388a2a9454224646cb296bd0ba0ce

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-13 09:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_quotas.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_quota.py', 'nova/objects/quotas.py', 'nova/quota.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/objects/migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'invert_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I6859fa057bf8fcfeed20b691eeaee331741ea1fa
Closes-Bug: 1296414
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quota-update when nova-compute startup finish

As of now reserved quota for the instances which were stuck in
deleting task-state while resizing was in progress, are not updated
accordingly on nova-compute start-up. This is because in present
code if quota delta is negative then reserved quota is not updated
while committing the quota.

Added new db interface to get latest migration object based on
instance id, as there might be many migration records for the same
instance id. To calculate correct quota delta, it requires latest
migration record.

Added new flag 'invert_quota' which default to False in quotas
object commit() method. With this change it is possible to invert the
reserved quota, if delta is negative and invert_quota value is True.

Added code to pass correct in_use quota to _delete_instance method
and update the reserved quota if instance was resizing when user has
sent request to delete the instance.

Change-Id: I6859fa057bf8fcfeed20b691eeaee331741ea1fa
Closes-Bug: 1296414

commit_message:
Fix attribute error with old glance backend

Glance (<= Havana) does not provide the virtual_size attribute for
images. So we first check if it is available to achieve compatibility
with older Glance versions.

Change-Id: I5970e8e6c61c4ee562cdc63a77661ad1801bf98d
Closes-Bug: #1482657

commit_message:
Allow case insensitive compare of choice values

This patch will help deployers who might specify a StrOpt value
that uses choices with the incorrect capitialization.

This will also help with backwards compatibility when a going from
a StrOpt that allowed case insensitivity to a StrOpt with choices.

Required for I8d9ee833263560caaffe083487abc5eda862f8ea

Change-Id: I51cebcca15aaf2970b0e00457cd156d84e7915e8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10224, 'name': 'Feodor Tersin', 'email': 'ftersin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ftersin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 14:55:36.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/tests/unit/base.py'], 'message': 'Use config fixrute in BaseTestCase

This gives all tests ability to set custom config options in all derived
classes with no extra efforts.
Also this patch sets fatal_exception_format_errors to True for
BaseTestCase, which will control parameters passed in an exception for
all derived classes.

Change-Id: I5a4c52a7d18fe406b67dabda9f32759a9190597c
'}]
commit_message:
Use config fixrute in BaseTestCase

This gives all tests ability to set custom config options in all derived
classes with no extra efforts.
Also this patch sets fatal_exception_format_errors to True for
BaseTestCase, which will control parameters passed in an exception for
all derived classes.

Change-Id: I5a4c52a7d18fe406b67dabda9f32759a9190597c

subject: Fix exception within exception handler for xmlsec1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 08:06:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/contrib/federation/idp.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception within exception handler for xmlsec1

When there is an error calling xmlsec1 the handler fails with a TypeError
because the Message object created by _LE() does not support appends.
Separate the output logging from the main logging to avoid this.

Change-Id: I63dbee2a51b7abf9d682c36019f1341f4c83973f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception within exception handler for xmlsec1

When there is an error calling xmlsec1 the handler fails with a TypeError
because the Message object created by _LE() does not support appends.
Separate the output logging from the main logging to avoid this.

Change-Id: I63dbee2a51b7abf9d682c36019f1341f4c83973f

commit_message:
Added code coverage report to ironic-webclient

This adds code coverage, via the karma-coverage plugin (istanbul),
to the ironic webclient. The results will be uploaded via infra's
"coverage-log" macro, which grabs everything in the 'cover/*'
directory.

Change-Id: Ia171805d4c2ed25f4b5ba5a4d8685cd87deee055

commit_message:
Added extension note for package maintainers.

Some package maintainers are unable to use bower-resolved dependencies
for their tests and package scripts. I have added documentation that
explains precisely where they can add their extension points, to
simplify their build steps.

All dependencies are now automatically watched and processed
during build/runtime, no pre-install copying or processing

commit_message:
Removed gulp update_dependencies and gulp bower.

All dependencies are now automatically watched and processed
during build/runtime, no pre-install copying or processing
is required. This removes the relevant commands, and adds
bower install to npm install so that the upstream dependencies
are chained.

Change-Id: Ib1cc996171a105fb57866fa8ba30f0febe3b96bd

JS libraries included from upstream carry their own license headers,

commit_message:
Explicitly include JS libraries

JS libraries included from upstream carry their own license headers,
so we can't minify those. Also, copying them directly into the src
directory isn't optimal. Instead, we copy all javascript included
in our bower dependencies, and reference them directly in
index.html.

Change-Id: I3c1d27ecd36c3f36e442a7d5a96ccf00ae9a3856

subject: Switched to using SCSS
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 10380, 'name': 'Josh Gachnang', 'email': 'josh@pcsforeducation.com', 'username': 'JoshNang'}, {'_account_id': 16628, 'name': 'Beth Elwell', 'email': 'e.r.elwell@gmail.com', 'username': 'bethelwell'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-14 22:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['bower.json', 'app/css/font-awesome.scss', 'app/css/main.scss', 'app/index.html', 'package.json', 'app/css/bootstrap.scss', 'gulpfile.js'], 'message': 'Switched to using SCSS

Horizon uses SCSS. While this does not prescribe what we use, it
does make contribution movements a bit easier.

This patch removes the CSS parsing from bower dependencies, instead
relying on explicit includes from new scss files in the ironic app css
directory. This is better, because it permits us to override theme variables
such as padding and color values before the bootstrap style is constructed.

Furthermore, it is probably not a good idea to concatenate all CSS files
into one lib.css, as some of these files are published under/with their
own license headers, and concatenation/minification usually strips those.

Change-Id: Ib369e8372ab120d2f98fd0dc818818bd15f381d9
'}]
commit_message:
Switched to using SCSS

Horizon uses SCSS. While this does not prescribe what we use, it
does make contribution movements a bit easier.

This patch removes the CSS parsing from bower dependencies, instead
relying on explicit includes from new scss files in the ironic app css
directory. This is better, because it permits us to override theme variables
such as padding and color values before the bootstrap style is constructed.

Furthermore, it is probably not a good idea to concatenate all CSS files
into one lib.css, as some of these files are published under/with their
own license headers, and concatenation/minification usually strips those.

Change-Id: Ib369e8372ab120d2f98fd0dc818818bd15f381d9

commit_message:
Differentiate heat-api from heat-api-* services

Assume heat-api is down, the heat-api process check would not raise
an alarm when lets say heat-api-cfn/heat-api-cloudwatch is still
running.

Hence while checking for heat-api we need to check for 'heat-api '
to differentiate it from heat-api-* services.

Change-Id: Ie08f559b6d32925d25a62c3ba19e829b6f33d602

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-14 22:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['package.json', 'README.md'], 'message': "Switched package to prepublish

The infra publishing lifecycle requires that we build a tarball
without the invocation of the actual 'publish' command. That
tarball is then uploaded to static.openstack.org. Switching from
the custom 'package' script to the 'prepublish' script hooks into
the 'npm pack' lifecycle, which will allow us to minify/package
before sending it to static.

Change-Id: If695c5a29b90e0019f7651a542fced602ace0383
"}]
commit_message:
Switched package to prepublish

The infra publishing lifecycle requires that we build a tarball
without the invocation of the actual 'publish' command. That
tarball is then uploaded to static.openstack.org. Switching from
the custom 'package' script to the 'prepublish' script hooks into
the 'npm pack' lifecycle, which will allow us to minify/package
before sending it to static.

Change-Id: If695c5a29b90e0019f7651a542fced602ace0383

commit_message:
Eliminate dir(node) -> 10% faster

Gain around 10% of processing speed by eliminating dir(node) call when
getting line ranges. Also keep only min/max lineno instead of full set.

Change-Id: I9e465f62787b8e6f01290bc5fd2b730696325cb8

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-17 13:34:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Check for obj_relationships in List objects

In obj_make_compatible() of List objects, only child_versions is used.
If obj_relationships is set on a List object, obj_make_compatible()
should also take that into consideration.

This change pulls out common code for finding the desired child version
for backporting, and then changes ObjectListBase's obj_make_compatible()
to check for child_versions first, and if that is empty, will use
obj_relationships for finding the child version.

Change-Id: I89217f1721c896bd2660354d4f4283e2e12ebe98
Closes-Bug: #1470617
"}]
commit_message:
Check for obj_relationships in List objects

In obj_make_compatible() of List objects, only child_versions is used.
If obj_relationships is set on a List object, obj_make_compatible()
should also take that into consideration.

This change pulls out common code for finding the desired child version
for backporting, and then changes ObjectListBase's obj_make_compatible()
to check for child_versions first, and if that is empty, will use
obj_relationships for finding the child version.

Change-Id: I89217f1721c896bd2660354d4f4283e2e12ebe98
Closes-Bug: #1470617

commit_message:
Enhance fail fast on error functionality

Make persister fail faster on errors.
Use one executor service for all perister threads.
Shutdown all threads in thread executor service on any error.
Catch java.lang.Throwable to catch java.lang.Error as well as java.lang.Exception.

Change-Id: I0dc421cf6bb4ab3f52c47e97b7f396483283b561

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-24 07:08:29.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/039_add_changes_to_satisfy_models_metadef.py'], 'message': 'Fix the db_sync problem in 039 for db2

When using db2 as the database backend, it encounters problem
when running db_sync in step 039 due to "SQL0669N  A system
required index cannot be dropped explicitly", which need to
drop the constraint first then recreate the index. And this
patch also fixes the problem of dropping some indexes which
only are created in non-db2 databases, meanwhile, it will not
break the logic for all other database backends.

Closes-Bug: #1434440

Change-Id: I628bfa9ab1e4e07b71b49fc0e5a6087679b642a6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the db_sync problem in 039 for db2

When using db2 as the database backend, it encounters problem
when running db_sync in step 039 due to "SQL0669N  A system
required index cannot be dropped explicitly", which need to
drop the constraint first then recreate the index. And this
patch also fixes the problem of dropping some indexes which
only are created in non-db2 databases, meanwhile, it will not
break the logic for all other database backends.

Closes-Bug: #1434440

Change-Id: I628bfa9ab1e4e07b71b49fc0e5a6087679b642a6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 12:16:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': "Disable using lvm-backed cinder on second partition for AIO's

Using lvm-backed cinder on a second partition of a secondary disk
is currently blocking patches from being merged in master due to
build failures in hpcloud. HP Cloud is the only build node pool
where this method is used.

This patch switches the implementation in hpcloud to use the same
method as in raxcloud. Hopefully this can unblock the gate check

Change-Id: I60c9a953ae017b8098f7f43db24959b425cb1306
"}]
commit_message:
Disable using lvm-backed cinder on second partition for AIO's

Using lvm-backed cinder on a second partition of a secondary disk
is currently blocking patches from being merged in master due to
build failures in hpcloud. HP Cloud is the only build node pool
where this method is used.

This patch switches the implementation in hpcloud to use the same
method as in raxcloud. Hopefully this can unblock the gate check
process to allow development to continue while the root cause for
this issue is investigated.

Partial-Bug: #1485917
Change-Id: I60c9a953ae017b8098f7f43db24959b425cb1306

commit_message:
Support delegation of bind_port to networking-odl backend driver.

The OpenDaylightMechanismDriver delegates bind_port to networking-odl
backend driver. Move check_segment toghether with bind_port as is
used only there. This will enabled extension of bind_port to
support other port types such as vhost-user in a separated patch-set
to networking-odl without requiring further changes to the front-end
component in neutron.

Change-Id: I27948ac0b440b8b4d04e496971593850e78739d0
Closes-Bug: #1477483
Depends-On: Id663147020b9780129c65ba0bb6d743a9de9cd4b

commit_message:
Remove usage of {centos,ubuntu}-versions.yaml file

Since old patching tests are removed already, the files
with packages versions aren't used by tests anymore. So
there is no need to update them after repositories
regeneration.
Also this patch should be merged to tests before the
following change is landed to master branch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/214333/

Otherwise repos regeneration will fail in tests.

Change-Id: I752b377558cbe3a2a4cdf6eaae42f6ab8c8c91d5
Related-bug: #1485599

The reservation engine is subject to failures due to concurrency;
the switch to pymysql is likely to also have a part in observed
failures. While no gate failures have been observed so far, this
is a time bomb waiting to explode and must be addressed.

For this reason this patch acts conservatively by ensuring the
API controllers do not use anymore reservation. The code for
reservation management is preserved, and will wired again on the
controller when these issues are sorted.

of this patch.

Related bug: #1486134

Change-Id: I2a95fef0fdf64ef8781bef99be0fdc743346c17a
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using quota reservations on base controller

The reservation engine is subject to failures due to concurrency;
the switch to pymysql is likely to also have a part in observed
failures. While no gate failures have been observed so far, this
is a time bomb waiting to explode and must be addressed.

For this reason this patch acts conservatively by ensuring the
API controllers do not use anymore reservation. The code for
reservation management is preserved, and will wired again on the
controller when these issues are sorted.

The devref for neutron quotas is updated accordingly as a part
of this patch.

Related bug: #1486134

Change-Id: I2a95fef0fdf64ef8781bef99be0fdc743346c17a

commit_message:
Add tests for python-cinderclient

Add tests for cinder volume creation and deletion
by ID and by Name.
Add test for cinder show volume output.
Add method to wait for given volume status.
Add method to check that volume deleted.
Add method to check that volume is not deleted (for negative cases).
Add method for volume deletion.
Add method to get Volume properties from CLI output.

Change-Id: I1e1f9bea2afc63e408a88e64fc1b6b6ee9f4e79b
Implements: partial blueprint cinderclient-functional-tests
Co-Authored-by: Kyrylo Romanenko <kromanenko@mirantis.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 10:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_odl.py', 'setup.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Updated from global requirements

Moved neutron dependency from requirements.txt into tox.ini since new
versions of pbr are not guaranteed to support -e git... dependencies in
requirements files.

Enforce stable/kilo branches for all git dependencies to make sure we
run against the same version of neutron repos as the driver.

Also revert "Fix unit tests" (acc3b5a44155a7fb6ffc462ee863beb492737654)
because it relied on the fact that we executed the test against Liberty
(which is wrong for Kilo branch of the driver).

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I88049ff7443b3b2f23a515d6207fea4490435698
'}]
commit_message:
Updated from global requirements

Moved neutron dependency from requirements.txt into tox.ini since new
versions of pbr are not guaranteed to support -e git... dependencies in
requirements files.

Enforce stable/kilo branches for all git dependencies to make sure we
run against the same version of neutron repos as the driver.

Also revert "Fix unit tests" (acc3b5a44155a7fb6ffc462ee863beb492737654)
because it relied on the fact that we executed the test against Liberty
(which is wrong for Kilo branch of the driver).

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I88049ff7443b3b2f23a515d6207fea4490435698

commit_message:
Run Python jobs for python-fuelclient

Fuel Client now supports running its Python tests
on OpenStack CI so it needs those tests to be turned
on in non-voting mode.

Closes-bug: #1476808

commit_message:
Add oslo_versionedobjects dependency for neutron

RDO doesn't keep their RPM dependencies up to date with latest
neutron changes to requirements.txt, so we have to pip install
the package.

Change-Id: Ic49a4dd3b85e9daf60c87b245b9784818fcb3bb2
Closes-Bug: #1486241

commit_message:
Add devstack examples for multi-node setups

This patch adds examples for multi node setup with local dragonflow
controller, also adds a service of df-etcd-server which is only enabled
where the distributed DB should run (ie the controller node)

Change-Id: I5cc109a7ae41f132e3024891177690a293706571

commit_message:
Tox to manage all test environments on its own

Functional tests have been moved to a separate tox
enviroment called functional, so running either py26
or py27 one will only trigger unit tests.

Scripts for prepairing and cleaning up Nailgun environments
have been factored out of run_tests.sh.

run_tests.sh is kept just compatibility reasons and will be
removed once FuelCI is updated.

DocImpact
Partial-bug: #1476808
Closes-bug: #1486030
Change-Id: I492ce5d1ed26a182cc6876594d4508088afd5411

commit_message:
Final decomposition of ML2 Nexus Driver

This changeset removes the remaining ML2 Nexus Driver Vendor
code from the neutron repo.  It has been moved to  the
networking-cisco repo.

Change-Id: I95540f35f80ad8eba4bc3f6fa37095842e42c037
Closes-bug:  #1482366
Implements:  blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

subject: Libvirt is moving around the wrong config file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-19 11:24:32.000000000', 'files': ['docker/common/nova/nova-libvirt/config-external.sh'], 'message': "Libvirt is moving around the wrong config file

Libvirt uses libvirtd.conf not libvirt.conf. Currently,
the config file get copied to '/etc/libvirt/libvirt.conf' and
libvirt creates its own libvirtd.conf and ignores the
configured libvirt.

Change-Id: I7a55b92c33ade72b7ac8ba028c67313479ad8343
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1486100
"}]
commit_message:
Libvirt is moving around the wrong config file

Libvirt uses libvirtd.conf not libvirt.conf. Currently,
the config file get copied to '/etc/libvirt/libvirt.conf' and
libvirt creates its own libvirtd.conf and ignores the
configured libvirt.

Change-Id: I7a55b92c33ade72b7ac8ba028c67313479ad8343
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1486100

commit_message:
Fix Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start

Check if request-id starts with 'req-' in context middleware,
if not then add prefix 'req-' to request-id.

Change-Id: I4fae1f6274b5d89fd3bdd1aefd4abc2129afd8ef
Closes-Bug: #1478690

commit_message:
Enable delete of retired services via nova-manage

There exists a admin API to delete retired services.
This enables the nova-manage util to delete retired
services as well.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-compute

Change-Id: If095856156c9fde8e7cca2812c665cb0d6508f0f

commit_message:
Remove VIF_TYPES constant

VIF_TYPES[1] lists all vif types including out-of-tree ones BUT is no
more used by neutron code.

This changes removes it and every VIF_TYPE_* constant in [1] only used
by VIF_TYPES.

[1] in neutron.extensions.portbindings

Change-Id: I39fc344361c21332b947f21f157d4f2a27caad47

api method instance_get_all_by_grantee_security_groups().

db calls in compute api trigger_members_refresh().

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-14 08:07:54.000000000', 'files': ['tests/validators/test_callable_validators.py', 'tests/X509/test_message_digest.py', 'anchor/validators.py', 'tests/X509/test_extension.py', 'anchor/X509/certificate.py', 'anchor/certificate_ops.py', 'tests/test_certificate_ops.py', 'requirements.txt', 'anchor/X509/signing_request.py', 'tests/X509/test_x509_csr.py', 'anchor/X509/name.py', 'tests/X509/test_utils.py', 'tests/test_functional.py', 'anchor/X509/message_digest.py', 'anchor/X509/utils.py', 'tests/X509/test_x509_name.py', 'anchor/X509/extension.py', 'tests/validators/test_base_validation_functions.py', 'tests/X509/test_x509_certificate.py'], 'message': "Integrate PyASN1 for certificate operations

Instead of relying on openssl code for certificate parsing, use the
ASN.1 representation directly. All previous features are supported. Not
all the extensions are full parsed yet, but the code doesn't require
them for now.

The code makes accessing and modifying the certificate structure simpler
and requires less error checking than the original version. The code
leaves few TODOs, but nothing that destroys previous behaviour.

It still uses the cryptography.io backend for loading keys and producing
signatures for the certificates.

Implements: blueprint direct-asn1
Change-Id: Ic555d3d056ca8da7016e2d8b434506cf214d06a1
"}]
commit_message:
Integrate PyASN1 for certificate operations

Instead of relying on openssl code for certificate parsing, use the
ASN.1 representation directly. All previous features are supported. Not
all the extensions are full parsed yet, but the code doesn't require
them for now.

The code makes accessing and modifying the certificate structure simpler
and requires less error checking than the original version. The code
leaves few TODOs, but nothing that destroys previous behaviour.

It still uses the cryptography.io backend for loading keys and producing
signatures for the certificates.

Implements: blueprint direct-asn1
Change-Id: Ic555d3d056ca8da7016e2d8b434506cf214d06a1

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-08-19 09:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/services/action_manager.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/types.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_workflows.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/test_exception_base.py', 'mistral/exceptions.py', 'mistral/utils/rest_utils.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlalchemy_db_api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_utils.py', 'mistral/engine/utils.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_environment.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_workbooks.py', 'mistral/utils/__init__.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_cron_triggers.py', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_actions.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/resource.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add pagination support for workflows query API

Add query params for workflow list REST API:

* limit: return a maximun number of items at a time, default is None, the
  query result will include all the resource items, which is backward
  compatible.

* marker: the ID of the last item in the previous list.

* sort_keys: columns to sort results by. Default: created_at.

* sort_dirs: directions to sort corresponding to sort_keys, "asc" or
  "desc" can be choosed. Default: asc. The length of sort_dirs can
  be equal or less than that of sort_keys.

Change-Id: Ie73d4457193999555ce9886d4de1297b4d0bc51d
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-query-enhancement
'}]
commit_message:
Add pagination support for workflows query API

Add query params for workflow list REST API:

* limit: return a maximun number of items at a time, default is None, the
  query result will include all the resource items, which is backward
  compatible.

* marker: the ID of the last item in the previous list.

* sort_keys: columns to sort results by. Default: created_at.

* sort_dirs: directions to sort corresponding to sort_keys, "asc" or
  "desc" can be choosed. Default: asc. The length of sort_dirs can
  be equal or less than that of sort_keys.

Change-Id: Ie73d4457193999555ce9886d4de1297b4d0bc51d
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-query-enhancement

commit_message:
Stop supervisor service when stopping container

When a user manually stops the container using dockerctl,
it should also be disabled in supervisor, blocking
auto-start. Likewise, supervisor should manage the
service when it was started by dockerctl.

Change-Id: I9ee112f38727c8f33f851b87baab5436b975ab69
Closes-Bug: #1485985

commit_message:
Default Region Configuration Property

It provides a configuration property region_name_for_services which contains
a default region name used to get services endpoints in the case that they are
several regions

commit_message:
Redone the structure of test file tree

Made the test file more compatible with the one
in upstream OpenStack by putting all tests to
tests/unit and tests/functional directories.

That brings the following pros:

 - Allows to run unit or functional tests separately
 - Allows to reuse existing CI jobs

Partial-bug: #1476808
Change-Id: I322ddda5007a36db0e4376ea2eb5230a5fd4ed29

commit_message:
Add check to NodeDeletionTaskManager for controllers to be deployed

In case we remove controller from ha env we must redeploy others which
is done in the manager. Check added to list of retrieved for deployment
controllers in order to make sure they are in appropriate for the
operation status. In opposite case we might faced bugs in particular
situations, for example, when environment is reset and implicit
deployment is started on nodes which still are undergoing the process and
that leads to unexpected errorfull behaviour as such described in the bug

Change-Id: I099660db1f8cd9d179f377799231635865286d3a
Closes-Bug: #1432615

commit_message:
Adding wsgi log formatting

This change adds the ability to customiz how the keystone
wsgi virtual hosts log information.  This is especially useful
if you have a load balancer and the source ip is being forwarded.

Change-Id: Id27179f1ca6001a1596f103013f6ca32ed23b6b4
Closes-bug: #1483776

commit_message:
Support an externally hosted keystone

This change allows the configuration of an external identity service for
multi-region configurations. The location of the keystone service can be
overriden in variable keystone_service_internal_lb_vip_address in
user_group_vars.yml.

Change-Id: Ic6a172f25a26b6af586fb1ce7703632057cecdac
Closes-Bug: #1464043

commit_message:
Add proxy support to S3 Store

This patch adds the option for an S3 connection to connect through a
proxy and adds 5 new optional configurations to the S3 store:

* s3_store_enable_proxy
* s3_store_proxy_host
* s3_store_proxy_port
* s3_store_proxy_user
* s3_store_proxy_password

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint http-proxy-support-for-s3

Change-Id: I4f329933d281e84cefd5176298cd91c7e4aca06d

commit_message:
Clarify the process for moving the v2 code

The previous spec proposed using a directory for the deprecated v2 code
named 'legacy-v2', but module names cannot include hyphens, so this
changes the proposed name to 'legacy_v2'. There is also some additional
comments added about the need to preserve the current APIRouter* class
names until they can be changed in api-paste.ini so that upgrades won't
break existing deployments.

Change-Id: I4f770f3ec74bd136abc3ab5d1c60ef0de670e694

subject: Add proper failure on disk create revert
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 12994, 'name': 'Christine Wang', 'email': 'christine911@gmail.com', 'username': 'ijuwang'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 11:53:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/storage.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add proper failure on disk create revert

When a disk fails to create, the task flow revert step will be invoked.
If the failure originates from elsewhere in the task, the result will be
the disk that was created and it will be deleted properly.  But if the
error originates within the disk create step, the result is a failure.

That failure was being passed down into the delete disk step, and then
the rollback was not properly executing.  This change adds a small check
to ensure that the rollback does not get invoked if the failure
originated from that step itself.

Change-Id: I294ea9731f8325132670a70474dce1288cb73796
Closes-Bug: 1486527
'}]
commit_message:
Add proper failure on disk create revert

When a disk fails to create, the task flow revert step will be invoked.
If the failure originates from elsewhere in the task, the result will be
the disk that was created and it will be deleted properly.  But if the
error originates within the disk create step, the result is a failure.

That failure was being passed down into the delete disk step, and then
the rollback was not properly executing.  This change adds a small check
to ensure that the rollback does not get invoked if the failure
originated from that step itself.

Change-Id: I294ea9731f8325132670a70474dce1288cb73796
Closes-Bug: 1486527

subject: Enable log_slave_updates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-19 07:51:39.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/my.cnf.j2'], 'message': 'Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473
'}]
commit_message:
Enable log_slave_updates

Without log_slave_updates enabled, the bin logs are only written on the
cluster server that handles the request. This makes database recovery
more difficult as the bin logs are spread across all servers and must be
combined manually in order to recover the database.

Enabling log_slave_updates ensures all nodes in the cluster contain the
complete bin logs and recovery can be performed from any cluster member.

Change-Id: I978d6aea93369382faeace96b7865b9e56a7995a
Closes-Bug: #1479473

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2015-08-19 07:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl_key_distribute.yml', 'playbooks/vars/configs/haproxy_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_apache.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl_self_signed.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl_user_provided.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/meta/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl_key_store.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_ssl_key_create.yml', 'playbooks/haproxy-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Keystone SSL cert/key distribution and configuration

This patch adds the option to provide an SSL certificate for the
Keystone service (either self-signed or user provided) and to
configure the endpoints and Keystone service appropriately.

* A new boolean variable called 'keystone_ssl' enables/disables
  the configuration of SSL for the Keystone service.

* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all keystone containers and used for the setup
  of SSL endpoints if the appropriate protocol is set.

* The internal/public and the admin endpoints can be set to be
  served via http or https seperately via the
  'keystone_service_*_proto' variables.

* The logic to determine the appropriate load balancing
  configuration based on the Keystone endpoint protocol has
  been implemented in the haproxy vars.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - keystone_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - keystone_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, but a Keystone endpoint
  has been configured for SSL, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on the first Keystone container and
  distributed to the other containers.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - keystone_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* A new variable called 'keystone_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the certificate
  properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

Upgrade notes:

* The SSL-based client authentication configuration in Apache
  has been removed as it appears to be unused.

* The minimum Ansible version for the os_keystone and
  haproxy_server roles have been increased to v1.9.0 as it's
  the minimum version that supports ternary filters.

* The boolean 'keystone_ssl_enabled' has been renamed to
  'keystone_ssl'. This maintains a pattern set in the haproxy
  role for enablement of ssl offloading in the load balancer.

* The Apache configuration appropriately implements the
  'SSLCACertificateFile' instead of the 'SSLCACertificatePath'
  directive in order to ensure that the appropriate signing
  certificate is provided to the browser.

* The 'keystone_self_signed_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'keystone_ssl_self_signed_regen'.

* The default names for the deployed keys/certificates have been
  changed:
  - /etc/ssl/certs/apache.cert  > /etc/ssl/certs/keystone.pem
  - /etc/ssl/private/apache.key > /etc/ssl/private/keystone.key

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1466827
Implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I4c5ea7b6bfc3d7d7230a7440fa501241826c9dee
Co-Authored-By: Miguel Grinberg <miguelgrinberg50@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Keystone SSL cert/key distribution and configuration

This patch adds the option to provide an SSL certificate for the
Keystone service (either self-signed or user provided) and to
configure the endpoints and Keystone service appropriately.

* A new boolean variable called 'keystone_ssl' enables/disables
  the configuration of SSL for the Keystone service.

* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all keystone containers and used for the setup
  of SSL endpoints if the appropriate protocol is set.

* The internal/public and the admin endpoints can be set to be
  served via http or https seperately via the
  'keystone_service_*_proto' variables.

* The logic to determine the appropriate load balancing
  configuration based on the Keystone endpoint protocol has
  been implemented in the haproxy vars.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - keystone_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - keystone_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, but a Keystone endpoint
  has been configured for SSL, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on the first Keystone container and
  distributed to the other containers.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - keystone_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* A new variable called 'keystone_ssl_self_signed_subject' has
  been implemented to allow the user to override the certificate
  properties, such as the CN and subjectAltName.

Upgrade notes:

* The SSL-based client authentication configuration in Apache
  has been removed as it appears to be unused.

* The minimum Ansible version for the os_keystone and
  haproxy_server roles have been increased to v1.9.0 as it's
  the minimum version that supports ternary filters.

* The boolean 'keystone_ssl_enabled' has been renamed to
  'keystone_ssl'. This maintains a pattern set in the haproxy
  role for enablement of ssl offloading in the load balancer.

* The Apache configuration appropriately implements the
  'SSLCACertificateFile' instead of the 'SSLCACertificatePath'
  directive in order to ensure that the appropriate signing
  certificate is provided to the browser.

* The 'keystone_self_signed_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'keystone_ssl_self_signed_regen'.

* The default names for the deployed keys/certificates have been
  changed:
  - /etc/ssl/certs/apache.cert  > /etc/ssl/certs/keystone.pem
  - /etc/ssl/private/apache.key > /etc/ssl/private/keystone.key

DocImpact
Partial-Bug: #1466827
Implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: I4c5ea7b6bfc3d7d7230a7440fa501241826c9dee
Co-Authored-By: Miguel Grinberg <miguelgrinberg50@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Adds a pep8 target to tox.ini

The will now run flake8 on all Python files and bashate on all shell
scripts. Right now I'm ignoring the bashate errors, since there were so
many of them. Follow up patches will start fixing those issues.

A few Python files had minor modifications to pass flake8.

Change-Id: I5f773eb6ea9f1311aa045951ff9bdad16cca6491
(cherry picked from commit 2f3d556c5e9b94335150434941f8a137a965a1c6)

This change updates the server_names and ipaddresses for the http

Closes-Bug: 1486076

commit_message:
Fix horizon http haproxy configuration

This change updates the server_names and ipaddresses for the http
horizon haproxy configuration when ssl is enabled. Currently when ssl is
enabled, a crit log message is thrown for "No content, source or symlink
specified" for the http horizon haproxy configuration because we are
passing empty arrays. We should be using 'undef' to prevent the
balancermembers from being configured.

Change-Id: Iada2ebbb61301e7d79dbcfc72d5a5ae07dd0052a
Closes-Bug: 1486076

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-08-19 09:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/network/neutron.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_assignment_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_verify_networks_task_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/consts.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/neutron_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_70.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/base.py'], 'message': 'Add IP assignment optimized for network template

IPs were allocated for every network on every node
regardless of network to nodes mapping which is set in template.
It led to excessive IP usage.
Now it is fixed so that IPs are allocated only for nodes where they are required.
And IP allocation is optimized for the case with network template and for other
cases partially.
A number of small fixes were made on the base of comments in earlier RCs.

IP allocation comparison in DB queries count (only for replaced part):
old version: 1 query per IP to allocate + 1 query per occupied IP in that range
new version: 1 queries per network (for all IPs) if (occupied IPs)+(IPs to allocate) <= MIN_IPS_PER_DB_QUERY
             2 queries per network otherwise (typically).
New version is much better for large numbers of nodes.
nodes |      queries count        |
count |   old   |   new           |
      |min| max |min|  max        |
    1 |  1|  1+N|  1|1+ceil(N/5)**|
   10 | 10| 10+N|  1|1+ceil(N/10) |
  100 |100|100+N|  1|1+ceil(N/100)|
where N is a number of occupied IPs.
** 5 here is value of MIN_IPS_PER_DB_QUERY.

Change-Id: I4479bcae9e80f7b96750f9fdb2868d6df164baf6
Closes-Bug: #1480345
'}]
commit_message:
Add IP assignment optimized for network template

IPs were allocated for every network on every node
regardless of network to nodes mapping which is set in template.
It led to excessive IP usage.
Now it is fixed so that IPs are allocated only for nodes where they are required.
And IP allocation is optimized for the case with network template and for other
cases partially.
A number of small fixes were made on the base of comments in earlier RCs.

IP allocation comparison in DB queries count (only for replaced part):
old version: 1 query per IP to allocate + 1 query per occupied IP in that range
new version: 1 queries per network (for all IPs) if (occupied IPs)+(IPs to allocate) <= MIN_IPS_PER_DB_QUERY
             2 queries per network otherwise (typically).
New version is much better for large numbers of nodes.
nodes |      queries count        |
count |   old   |   new           |
      |min| max |min|  max        |
    1 |  1|  1+N|  1|1+ceil(N/5)**|
   10 | 10| 10+N|  1|1+ceil(N/10) |
  100 |100|100+N|  1|1+ceil(N/100)|
where N is a number of occupied IPs.
** 5 here is value of MIN_IPS_PER_DB_QUERY.

Change-Id: I4479bcae9e80f7b96750f9fdb2868d6df164baf6
Closes-Bug: #1480345

subject: Update haproxy restart mechanism
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13948, 'name': 'Bart≈Çomiej Piotrowski', 'email': 'bpiotrowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'bpiotrowski'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 17:14:03.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/haproxy_service.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/haproxy_restart.pp'], 'message': "Update haproxy restart mechanism

Previously, we were restarting haproxy for every balancermember
configuration even if there were no changes. This was resulting in
haproxy running multiple times. With this change we are creating a new
wrapper class called openstack::ha::haproxy_restart that contains a
single refreshonly exec called 'haproxy-restart'. This exec is notified
by new haproxy::listen and haproxy::balancermember configurations to
restart haproxy only if there is a change.  With this change, haproxy
will only restart if there is an actual configuration change and we will
only be executing a restart once.

Change-Id: I247b66c8b1cac04a1eeeb22377cd06809ef93636
Closes-Bug: 1485991
"}]
commit_message:
Update haproxy restart mechanism

Previously, we were restarting haproxy for every balancermember
configuration even if there were no changes. This was resulting in
haproxy running multiple times. With this change we are creating a new
wrapper class called openstack::ha::haproxy_restart that contains a
single refreshonly exec called 'haproxy-restart'. This exec is notified
by new haproxy::listen and haproxy::balancermember configurations to
restart haproxy only if there is a change.  With this change, haproxy
will only restart if there is an actual configuration change and we will
only be executing a restart once.

Change-Id: I247b66c8b1cac04a1eeeb22377cd06809ef93636
Closes-Bug: 1485991

commit_message:
Python 3: fix test_utils

In Python 3, the error message returned when unpacking too many values is a bit
different from the one we see in Python 2:

Python 2:
  ValueError: too many values to unpack

Python 3:
  ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected <number of values>)

Blueprint: neutron-python3
Change-Id: Ib607a526c007567a370c521fd7e2e4f8b504b934

commit_message:
Implement /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork

This patch replaces the mocked version of /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork
with the actual Neutron call. The unit test for the endpoint is also
implemented.

Change-Id: I58517069470f1689d486e6a96a094f0dac959116
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add keys directory to ostf container

OSTF need to reach SSL certificates for public endpoint
to create trusted secured connection instead using
'--insecure' option to services.

Change-Id: I3d35253569a99d59378497db5e1c41c7bc4d3efe
Closes-Bug: #1485633

commit_message:
Fix exception message about unavailable backend

At this moment if MySQL or PosrgreSQL are not installed the tests
will be skipped or failed with message 'database '%s' unavailable'.
Change 'database' -> 'backend'.

Change-Id: Id57f86a007f99c76f2ef2188279cad016433599f

commit_message:
Sync nova_admin_tenant_id_setter from upstream

Remove custom provider change due to implemented
cutom retry logic is faily. The solution is to
sync upstream provider.

Source: 6.0.0 c83277d21c42da040c8d8d34d2346da6ac319950
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron

Closes-bug: #1483648

Change-Id: I9d5f36ab528864c3cd5b7c993e8051109e054e0c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fixed lack of context for triggers

If set auth_enable to false in Mistral config keystone would not be used. So
triggers would not get a trust_id. Without this id context is not assigned.

Change-Id: I6d7d99da08cd78c1db83afff6fb79d37816f99ff
Closes-Bug: #1473980

commit_message:
Add option for force https on master node nginx

If you need to enable https only for master node,
add strings:

"SSL":
  "force_https": "true"

to /etc/fuel/astute.yaml on master node and rebuild
nginx container. Plain http access will be disabled
and only https remains

Partial-bug: #1479778
Change-Id: Ie0e892382b06a97b703d2c1560aa1f59236d1077

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-04 13:49:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Enable --cell_name in nova migration list

According to
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html#ext-os-migrations
nova support list migrations based on its cellname
however, the migration itself don't have cell name information
and currently the --cell_name didn't take any effect.

So this patch suggest instead of list migration with cell name,
we can add a filter by using 'node' name. So user can search the migrations
with the node name as param.

Another patch will change the nova client to replace '--cell_name'
with '--node_name' so that it will be not confusing.

There is no API change in this patch, but Doc need change.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic0dfb2c113b1f4f6803bbe6ae7a1ae69044d28b9
Partial-Bug: #1360988
"}]
commit_message:
Enable --cell_name in nova migration list

According to
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html#ext-os-migrations
nova support list migrations based on its cellname
however, the migration itself don't have cell name information
and currently the --cell_name didn't take any effect.

So this patch suggest instead of list migration with cell name,
we can add a filter by using 'node' name. So user can search the migrations
with the node name as param.

Another patch will change the nova client to replace '--cell_name'
with '--node_name' so that it will be not confusing.

There is no API change in this patch, but Doc need change.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic0dfb2c113b1f4f6803bbe6ae7a1ae69044d28b9
Partial-Bug: #1360988

Explicitly set public ssl host dependence

Setup dependence for public ssl record addition in hosts file
to avoid using of uninitialized hostname.

Closes-bug: #1484963

handle gw_info outside of the db transaction on router creation

Move the gateway interface creation outside the DB transaction
to avoid lock timeout.

Closes-bug: 1485809

commit_message:
Update 'conflicts' list of 'compute-vmware' role

Compute-vmware role cannot be combined with any other roles.
This change fixes specification violation (see 'Proposed change'):
https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-specs/blob/master/specs/7.0/compute-vmware-role.rst

Change-Id: I98b0c1f7e5bc7adff664964e7c0752aa78cc4958
Closes-bug: #1485554

commit_message:
Revise cluster-scale-in/out default value

When manually scale-in/out nodes, if 'count' option
is not configured, the default value should be '1'
instead of '0'.

Change-Id: Ic647ee17a2b06d5085fbb934262bbb46824d2f18

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 13671, 'name': 'Vladislav Belogrudov', 'email': 'v.belogrudov@yadro.com', 'username': 'vb'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-19 03:19:01.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'etc/kolla/globals.yml', 'tools/kolla-ansible'], 'message': "Move defaults.yml to group_vars/all.yml

The purpose for having defaults.yml on the command line was originally
for variable inheritance. Over the past month we have slowly changed
how things are inherited (like ports) allowing us to place these
'defaults' into the group_vars/all.yml location as they should be
values that go unchanged (but can be overridden).

Change-Id: I2becec66bf431bfc9d88fc825b5380c1e173ca70
Partially-Implements: blueprint update-configs
"}]
commit_message:
Move defaults.yml to group_vars/all.yml

The purpose for having defaults.yml on the command line was originally
for variable inheritance. Over the past month we have slowly changed
how things are inherited (like ports) allowing us to place these
'defaults' into the group_vars/all.yml location as they should be
values that go unchanged (but can be overridden).

Change-Id: I2becec66bf431bfc9d88fc825b5380c1e173ca70
Partially-Implements: blueprint update-configs

commit_message:
Keep user id and project id in subrequests env

Keep HTTP_X_USER_ID and HTTP_X_PROJECT_ID to be available as
user_id and project_id in storage.objects.outgoing.bytes in
ceilometer when downloading a multipart object.

Change-Id: I0f4734f021e5d6e84d48ed9bebeb321d7a9590ad

commit_message:
Allow empty/None output values

Currently validation fails if a template output Value is set to
something which evaluates to False. This change makes the check
look for the Value key instead.

This fixes what appears to be a behaviour regression from Juno->Kilo.

Change-Id: I0f5ae779aa46b243c66228e06fa652fb67ea06bf
Closes-Bug: #1486182

Currently stacks are deleted on integration test cleanup but no
polling is done for DELETE_COMPLETE, so the test will pass even though
the stack may be in a DELETE_FAILED state.

This change uses _stack_delete for all cleanup stack deleting, which
polls for complete.

Change-Id: Ic44b27130596cf3fa8616608a091b683ea131e0b
Closes-Bug: #1486303
'}]
commit_message:
Assert DELETE_COMPLETE on all stack delete cleanup

Currently stacks are deleted on integration test cleanup but no
polling is done for DELETE_COMPLETE, so the test will pass even though
the stack may be in a DELETE_FAILED state.

This change uses _stack_delete for all cleanup stack deleting, which
polls for complete.

Change-Id: Ic44b27130596cf3fa8616608a091b683ea131e0b
Closes-Bug: #1486303

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 17:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/swift.py', 'heat/tests/clients/test_heat_client.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'py3-testlist', 'heat/tests/openstack/test_waitcondition.py', 'heat/tests/clients/test_clients.py', 'heat/engine/clients/__init__.py', 'heat/tests/clients/test_nova_client.py'], 'message': "py34: heat.tests.client/openstack

* importutils.import_object results in a cfg.NoSuchOptError than
  a RuntimeError, handle the cfg.NoSuchOptError too.
* text.MIMEText content cannot be None in python3, use an empty
  string instead if the content is None.
* convert to bytes before using hashlib.sha256
* add a message keyword argument along with the cinder exception
  because self.__class__.message doesn't exist for exceptions in py34
* assert whether the string is against exception.args instead of the
  exception object itself.
* assert against a dictionary rather than a flattened string
  for consistent checking
* convert json strings to json before asserting/comparing

Change-Id: I5bbbc75373ce8009f0791cd2c7df1ba4c2d473b2
"}]
commit_message:
py34: heat.tests.client/openstack

* importutils.import_object results in a cfg.NoSuchOptError than
  a RuntimeError, handle the cfg.NoSuchOptError too.
* text.MIMEText content cannot be None in python3, use an empty
  string instead if the content is None.
* convert to bytes before using hashlib.sha256
* add a message keyword argument along with the cinder exception
  because self.__class__.message doesn't exist for exceptions in py34
* assert whether the string is against exception.args instead of the
  exception object itself.
* assert against a dictionary rather than a flattened string
  for consistent checking
* convert json strings to json before asserting/comparing

Change-Id: I5bbbc75373ce8009f0791cd2c7df1ba4c2d473b2

commit_message:
Use one data container for all data volumes

The previous method of using the API image for a data container
worked, but resulted in more data being bindmounted and copied
into the system.  This patch resolves that by essentially using
a distro-type as a FROM in a Dockerfile to generate
distro-type-data.  Further all of the data containers used
throughout ansible are modified to use this new data container.

Change-Id: I8846573d4f2d4b98d4f46c770bfefc6d4c5cd0b5
Partially-Implements: blueprint one-data-container

Target is the following secsions.

commit_message:
Don't add sinon to static/vendor

Doing this slows down build process. Sinon should go to
static/tests. Also don't include tests in build process.

Closes-Bug: #1486096

commit_message:
Change formula for number of service workers

Worker formula is changed. It's limited to 2 in minimal case when
server has only one CPU. Also, it's limited to 16 processes for
servers that have more than 16 physical cores.
Operators may override the value for every service updating hash
in hiera. This change helps to limit number of connections to
MySQL/Memcache/Rabbit

Upstream commit for glance-registry workers:
I71eb22d2ad15cd9c9d50e3370a3867f7298b47ca

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9f6ece34774f628214446569c851268af457399b
Related-bug: #1475433
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-18 16:45:48.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/progress.py', 'heat/tests/aws/test_instance.py', 'heat/tests/nova/test_server.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/tests/engine/test_progress.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/ec2/instance.py'], 'message': "Do not use rich objects is servers update

- Use new ServerUpdateProgress tasks that support delayed
  API calls (not only checks).
  As this new task imposes restrictions on compute plugin API,
  move all Server*Progress classes to new, plugin-agnostic module.
  Simple unit tests for this class added.
- Changed logic in Nova client plugin to not use scheduler tasks.
- Moved server interface attach/detach to Nova client plugin.
- Split resize in two distinct methods 'resize' and 'verify_resize',
  with their own checkers. This allows better handling of such 'delayed'
  VM status transitions as
  ACTIVE->[resize]->ACTIVE->RESIZING->VERIFY_RESIZE->[confirm]->
  ->VERIFY_RESIZE->ACTIVE
  It might also make it easier later to plug a user notification in
  verify_resize instead of optimistically confirming it.
- rebuild/resize and interface attach/detach are also made more resilent,
  tolerating intermittent API failures, allowing update logic
  to retry API call later.
- Instance.handle_update was refactored similar to Server resource,
  with building tasks for update moved to separate private methods.

Change-Id: Ic78adf878aac09e56f5c50052ee78bdf5b11aa21
Partial-Bug: #1393268
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use rich objects is servers update

- Use new ServerUpdateProgress tasks that support delayed
  API calls (not only checks).
  As this new task imposes restrictions on compute plugin API,
  move all Server*Progress classes to new, plugin-agnostic module.
  Simple unit tests for this class added.
- Changed logic in Nova client plugin to not use scheduler tasks.
- Moved server interface attach/detach to Nova client plugin.
- Split resize in two distinct methods 'resize' and 'verify_resize',
  with their own checkers. This allows better handling of such 'delayed'
  VM status transitions as
  ACTIVE->[resize]->ACTIVE->RESIZING->VERIFY_RESIZE->[confirm]->
  ->VERIFY_RESIZE->ACTIVE
  It might also make it easier later to plug a user notification in
  verify_resize instead of optimistically confirming it.
- rebuild/resize and interface attach/detach are also made more resilent,
  tolerating intermittent API failures, allowing update logic
  to retry API call later.
- Instance.handle_update was refactored similar to Server resource,
  with building tasks for update moved to separate private methods.

Change-Id: Ic78adf878aac09e56f5c50052ee78bdf5b11aa21
Partial-Bug: #1393268

commit_message:
Raise user-friendly exception in case of connection failed

In the scenario of network interruption or connection manually shutdown,
the service api can't be used any more, we should catch the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1484804

commit_message:
Allow NODE_DELETE action to steal node lock

This patch allows NODE_DELETE action to steal node lock. This can
prevent node being locked permanently by action which died
accidentally in some special cases, e.g. engine is killed forcedly
when node action is in progress.

Change-Id: I76f5dd16c43ebda397e74a5cb8239eaeb82e39b4

commit_message:
Make the dragonflow devstack process pluggable for DB drivers

Allow drivers to implement installation/cleaning and start/stop
logic in a seperate bash file and have the main plugin.sh
genericly call the methods.
The DB driver to use is sourced at the beginning of plugin.sh
according to the enabled service flag in local.conf

Change-Id: Id3edbd9786b712979ebdba5fa0a5d5152be378d2

Add configuration file to dragonflow local controller

This patch introduce configuration file to dragonflow parameters in
the plugin and in the local controller.
One of the parameters is the pluggable DB layer which can be
changed in the configuration.

Some methods in the common util module contains methods specific to
ML2.  Move them to a separate ML2 util module for better organization.

Also, instead of definiing multiple filter decorators to handle

commit_message:
Move ML2 util methods from common util

Some methods in the common util module contains methods specific to
ML2.  Move them to a separate ML2 util module for better organization.

Also, instead of definiing multiple filter decorators to handle
different resource types, define one and let it figure out the network
type within it based on the mechanism context object type passed in.

Change-Id: Ie92cf516c090e2432a9b0fe5e95e2611474674f9
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Increase connection backlogs for apache

This change increases the net.core.somaxconn from the defaults of 128
to 4096 and increases net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog from the defaults of
128 to 8192.  These values only get applied as part of the apache
modular task.

Change-Id: I2d4c060ffb0c09096fc86bc7d22efba25de29cd4
Closes-Bug: 1485644
