subject: Adds engine option to make dicts iterable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 21:16:48.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/legacy.py', 'yaql/language/specs.py', 'yaql/language/runner.py', 'yaql/language/yaqltypes.py', 'yaql/tests/test_legacy.py'], 'message': "Adds engine option to make dicts iterable

By default yaql 1.0 will not assume dicts to be iterable.
However because of yaql 0.2 had such behavior and some
users may still want to have it (for example because Python
has it) now in can be turned on. This is done by default
for legacy engine but not for modern one.

Also because SmartType's check method had no access
to engine options additional parameter (engine) was added.
Because previously signature was changed to have *args/**kwargs
backward compatibility retained

Change-Id: Ic3d65d8cb5caff43dee976dd9ba63f4caecf7dff
"}]
commit_message:
Adds engine option to make dicts iterable

By default yaql 1.0 will not assume dicts to be iterable.
However because of yaql 0.2 had such behavior and some
users may still want to have it (for example because Python
has it) now in can be turned on. This is done by default
for legacy engine but not for modern one.

Also because SmartType's check method had no access
to engine options additional parameter (engine) was added.
Because previously signature was changed to have *args/**kwargs

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 09:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Bump min tox version to 1.7

Tox optionnal dependency was introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203237/ but this feature requires
tox 1.7+

Without this patch, with tox 1.6, tox runs fail with "Directory
'.[vmdk]' is not installable. File 'setup.py' not found."

Closes-Bug: #1484035
Change-Id: I7b04d902634d7a447cfa89f22365b0741a03c17c'}]
commit_message:
Bump min tox version to 1.7

Tox optionnal dependency was introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203237/ but this feature requires
tox 1.7+

Without this patch, with tox 1.6, tox runs fail with "Directory
'.[vmdk]' is not installable. File 'setup.py' not found."

Closes-Bug: #1484035
Change-Id: I7b04d902634d7a447cfa89f22365b0741a03c17c

commit_message:
Remove enable_plugin for LBaaS

enable_plugin for lbaas was redundant since enabling q-lbaas service
took care of installing lbaas.

Partially Implements: bp/clean-up-devstack-plugin
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/clean-up-devstack-plugin
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I7807f40978ff46f0786cf6ebbdc65a14da1d4a15

commit_message:
Update bandit.yaml to the latest

The existing bandit.yaml was based on 0.10.1 version of bandit.
Commit I9504c44ac575b47b256496e833dd53a9dce113d2 adopts version
0.13.2 of bandit.  As a result, the bandit.yaml needs to be synced
with the standard version.

Also, with the newest bandit, some #nosec tags can be removed.

Change-Id: I503cd33d401b104aa502e7909f949c438a6248e6

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-28 11:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/opts.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/test_opts.py'], 'message': "Don't assume everyone uses `CONF`

Not all projects use the global `CONF` object and assuming makes
breaking projects using this middleware easy.

This change adds a workaround that will allow projects not using global
CONF to upgrade to the latest keystonemiddleware/keystoneclient
versions.

NOTE: keystonemiddleware should provide a function to allow consumers
for registering config options on a non-global conf object.

Closes-bug: #1406218
Change-Id: Iec12dae9a99fd9164634960e7984a7556ef183f2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume everyone uses `CONF`

Not all projects use the global `CONF` object and assuming makes
breaking projects using this middleware easy.

This change adds a workaround that will allow projects not using global
CONF to upgrade to the latest keystonemiddleware/keystoneclient
versions.

NOTE: keystonemiddleware should provide a function to allow consumers
for registering config options on a non-global conf object.

Closes-bug: #1406218
Change-Id: Iec12dae9a99fd9164634960e7984a7556ef183f2

commit_message:
Allow deployment when DVR is enabled and L2 pop and tunneling are disabled

Deployment with enabled Neutron DVR and disabled L2 population should be
allowed in case of VLAN segmentation for private networks.
Since this patch has been merged (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/166707/)
such combination is allowed in Neutron.

Change-Id: Ideb2dd0dcef4e478ed4aa5a151c30e6e2cb5332e
Closes-bug: #1475283

Added the following features for admin volumes types

1. "Create Volume Type" dialog should include a description field.
2. The volume types table should include description column.
3. The volume types table name and description columns are in-line
editable.
4. The 'Edit Volume Type' action is added for the volume type. User should
   be able to update volume type name and description.

Added the following features in project volumes

1. "Create Volume" dialog will have description for the selected volume
   type when volume type select is available.
2. "No Volume type" will have some description as well.

Implements: blueprint volume-type-description
Change-Id: I7c8548756bcd3566873876bbc59f9b9c21d6846b
'}]
commit_message:
Added volume type description for volume type

Added the following features for admin volumes types

1. "Create Volume Type" dialog should include a description field.
2. The volume types table should include description column.
3. The volume types table name and description columns are in-line
editable.
4. The 'Edit Volume Type' action is added for the volume type. User should
   be able to update volume type name and description.

Added the following features in project volumes

1. "Create Volume" dialog will have description for the selected volume
   type when volume type select is available.
2. "No Volume type" will have some description as well.

Implements: blueprint volume-type-description
Change-Id: I7c8548756bcd3566873876bbc59f9b9c21d6846b

AttributeError and ValueError which are python exceptions should be
removed from the map list.

commit_message:
Fix some exception mapping miss

AttributeError and ValueError which are python exceptions should be
removed from the map list.
ProfileInUse should be mapped to HTTPConflict.
Add InternalError and map it to HTTPInternalServerError.
Sort the map list.

Partially implements blueprint senlin-exception-handling

Change-Id: Id8bd3e79adf2bb5186835adb83728a8b3903c926

commit_message:
Updates to make diff_branches work again

This includes:

  installed

  to autohelp.py

commit_message:
Sync process utils from oslo for execute callbacks

------------------------------------------------
The sync pulls in the following changes:

Ifc23325 Add 2 callbacks to processutils.execute()
I22b2d7b processutils: ensure on_completion callback is always called
I59d5799 Let oslotest manage the six.move setting for mox
I245750f Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`
Ia5bb418 Fix exception message in openstack.common.processutils.execute
-----------------------------------------------

Related-Bug: 1387543
Change-Id: I22b2d7bde8797276f7670bc289d915dab5122481

commit_message:
Provide per volume unique task flow names

The NPIV volume adapter has a post execute task (to set the fabric
state).  It should be uniquely named in the scenario where a VM may
connect multiple volumes to it within a single command call (ex. spawn).

Change-Id: I73c58a7ac42b31b2fbaf89f2fec4e40bddc13b2d
Closes-Bug: 1486239

commit_message:
Cinder bootstrap container is not initializing the DB

When running cinder-ansible, the cinder db is never being initialized.
The bootstrap task needs to be fixed in order for cinder to run the db sync.

Change-Id: I01c5f5c34773ffc4e4f7fc7088a7277115db94dc
Closes-Bug: #1485745

commit_message:
Avoid using 0 as API_WORKERS

The 0 value of workers option will indicate different meaning in different
projects, In some case, min value of workers options is limited to 1.

And also, according to the TODO item of this related change, the two
related bug has been resolved. So we can remove the previous change.

Change-Id: I051944c5d410860c6d2fbb0a6ddf40dbcc95f3d1

commit_message:
Add service API support in client side

$ mistral service-list
+---------------+----------------+
| Name          | Type           |
+---------------+----------------+
| mistral_29703 | engine_group   |
| mistral_29703 | api_group      |
| mistral_29703 | executor_group |
+---------------+----------------+

Change-Id: I9be8c74c3fbab7782a9056a70075e7963e9b78f4
Implements: blueprint mistral-service-cli-support

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 01:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of exception converter in db/api.py

The exception converter was necessary because the exceptions the
oslo db decorator looked for before were statically defined. The
retry decorator now accepts an exception_checker argument that takes
a function to call on exceptions to determine if they should be
caught.

This patch gets rid of the converted and replaces the one use case
with the new exception_checker argument.

Closes-Bug: #1485819
Change-Id: Ic619b03737cbf51276f87c4458ecc4183424731c
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of exception converter in db/api.py

The exception converter was necessary because the exceptions the
oslo db decorator looked for before were statically defined. The
retry decorator now accepts an exception_checker argument that takes
a function to call on exceptions to determine if they should be
caught.

This patch gets rid of the converted and replaces the one use case
with the new exception_checker argument.

Closes-Bug: #1485819
Change-Id: Ic619b03737cbf51276f87c4458ecc4183424731c

The exception message of illegal sort_dir changed in latest
oslo_db update. This patch fixes related test cases to make them
work.

commit_message:
Quota enforcement: python3 compatibility

This patch does a simple fix to the quota DB driver in order
to ensure its compatibility with python3 and adds the quota
enforcement unit tests to the list of those executed as a part
of the py34 test environment.

Change-Id: I9b5601632866e1fb42f860d1cca5f77b5f14f2c8
Related-blueprint: better-quotas

commit_message:
Reservations support

Add the concept of resource reservation in neutron.
Usage tracking logic is also updated to support reservations.
Reservations are not however available with the now deprecated
configuration-based quota driver.

The base API controller will now use reservations to perform
quota checks rather than counting resource usage and then
invoking the limit_check routine.

The limit_check routine however has not been removed and
depreacated as a part of this patch. In order to ensure all
quota drivers expose a consistent interface, a
make_reservation method has been added to the configuration
based driver as well. This method simply performs "old-style"
limit checks by counting resource usage and then invoking
limit_check.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint better-quotas.

Change-Id: Ifea07f461def564884af5b291c8a56655a4d818b

subject: Move optional backend dependencies into setup.cfg [extras]
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 16:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move optional backend dependencies into setup.cfg [extras]

The dogpile and mongo backends are optional so therefore the
dependencies that are only used for those backends are optional.

This makes use of the 'extras' capability in setuptools to declare those
as optional dependencies if you're using those backends.

If a consumer of oslo.cache wants to use the dogpile backend, for
example, then they install oslo.cache like 'sudo pip install
oslo.cache[dogpile]'.

Note that the dogpile dependency is left in requirements.txt because
the oslo_cache.core module has an unconditional import on that library.

Change-Id: I28332964d568bda405fb8d1376d50db49d288b94
"}]
commit_message:
Move optional backend dependencies into setup.cfg [extras]

The dogpile and mongo backends are optional so therefore the
dependencies that are only used for those backends are optional.

This makes use of the 'extras' capability in setuptools to declare those
as optional dependencies if you're using those backends.

If a consumer of oslo.cache wants to use the dogpile backend, for
example, then they install oslo.cache like 'sudo pip install
oslo.cache[dogpile]'.

Note that the dogpile dependency is left in requirements.txt because
the oslo_cache.core module has an unconditional import on that library.

Change-Id: I28332964d568bda405fb8d1376d50db49d288b94

Right now RedisLock's __init__ method is not calling its super  __init__
method, as it should be doing.

It's also using attribute named "_acquired" instead of "acquired" and
creating a property name instead of using inherited name attribute  like

This patch changes these behaviors to be consistent with other locks.

Change-Id: If642522637c653a1fb9ad345570fe8a53930cd53
'}]
commit_message:
Make RedisLock's init consistent with other locks

Right now RedisLock's __init__ method is not calling its super  __init__
method, as it should be doing.

It's also using attribute named "_acquired" instead of "acquired" and
creating a property name instead of using inherited name attribute  like
other methods are.

This patch changes these behaviors to be consistent with other locks.

Change-Id: If642522637c653a1fb9ad345570fe8a53930cd53

commit_message:
Reservations support

Add the concept of resource reservation in neutron.
Usage tracking logic is also updated to support reservations.
Reservations are not however available with the now deprecated
configuration-based quota driver.

The base API controller will now use reservations to perform
quota checks rather than counting resource usage and then
invoking the limit_check routine.

The limit_check routine however has not been removed and
depreacated as a part of this patch. In order to ensure all
quota drivers expose a consistent interface, a
make_reservation method has been added to the configuration
based driver as well. This method simply performs "old-style"
limit checks by counting resource usage and then invoking
limit_check.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint better-quotas.

Change-Id: Ifea07f461def564884af5b291c8a56655a4d818b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 10881, 'name': 'Neill Cox', 'email': 'neill@ingenious.com.au', 'username': 'neillc'}]
revisions: [{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-17 22:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/babel_extract_angular.py', 'horizon/utils/babel_extract_angular.py'], 'message': 'Babel extractor translating inner tags The current extractor does not support nesting of inner tags. This creates problems when we have something like this " hello beautiful world". The message extraction gets prematurely cut off. Futhermore, the extractor does not support trimming. This is important because angular-gettext trims the content and use that as the msgid. The goal is to get it working with angular-gettext, hence, we also need to trim our messages. Change-Id: I9265f731431521240dddd24bb87baa97cc3ed4b5 Implements: blueprint babel-translate-inner-tags '}]
commit_message: Babel extractor translating inner tags The current extractor does not support nesting of inner tags. This creates problems when we have something like this " hello beautiful world". The message extraction gets prematurely cut off. Futhermore, the extractor does not support trimming. This is important because angular-gettext trims the content and use that as the msgid. The goal is to get it working with angular-gettext, hence, we also need to trim our messages. Change-Id: I9265f731431521240dddd24bb87baa97cc3ed4b5 Implements: blueprint babel-translate-inner-tags

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 15:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cover.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add script to report uncovered new lines

Let's update the coverage job behavior - it will run coverage on
current master and then it will run coverage on Head and compare
number of new lines w/o test coverage. The default number of
allowed uncovered lines is 4. If more lines uncovered job will
fail. We'll keep this job non-voting, but this script should help
us a lot to monitor the degradation of test coverage.

Change-Id: I16336cee3570f50bf80bc84ddb081737c1dd9dab
"}]
commit_message:
Add script to report uncovered new lines

Let's update the coverage job behavior - it will run coverage on
current master and then it will run coverage on Head and compare
number of new lines w/o test coverage. The default number of
allowed uncovered lines is 4. If more lines uncovered job will
fail. We'll keep this job non-voting, but this script should help
us a lot to monitor the degradation of test coverage.

Change-Id: I16336cee3570f50bf80bc84ddb081737c1dd9dab

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'Ond≈ôej Nov√Ω', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-17 21:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/ringbuilder.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py'], 'message': "Make swift-ring-builder filename usage more consistent

Sometimes the given argument is internally altered and another filename is used
without a note to the operator. Even worse, a given .ring.gz filename is
sometimes written out as builder file, without updating the corresponding
.builder file.

There is already a method to parse the given argv and return the name of the
builder and ring file. However, it's rarely used and no warning is given to the
user if it is altered. This patch uses the already parsed builder and ring file
name instead of argv[1], and also adds a note to the user if the used filename
is differently to the one given as argument.

Closes-Bug: 1482096
Change-Id: I2f8ef23aeab8b07caaa799f7dcd57e684b4b2ad2
"}]
commit_message:
Make swift-ring-builder filename usage more consistent

Sometimes the given argument is internally altered and another filename is used
without a note to the operator. Even worse, a given .ring.gz filename is
sometimes written out as builder file, without updating the corresponding
.builder file.

There is already a method to parse the given argv and return the name of the
builder and ring file. However, it's rarely used and no warning is given to the
user if it is altered. This patch uses the already parsed builder and ring file
name instead of argv[1], and also adds a note to the user if the used filename
is differently to the one given as argument.

Closes-Bug: 1482096
Change-Id: I2f8ef23aeab8b07caaa799f7dcd57e684b4b2ad2

A complete proposal is like below steps:
1. Assume the HDFS user in manila.conf has the authority to launch hdfs command.
2. Set run_as_root to False if there is no argument by default, all the cases in
Manila HDFS Driver don't need be a root to run hdfs command.
3. If root is required, please deliver run_as_root parameter and set it as True

Change-Id: I310713c3c1b74ff9990832f61e777cf4c12696fe
Closes-Bug: #1481567

commit_message:
Fix bug to run command as root in HDFS driver

A complete proposal is like below steps:
1. Assume the HDFS user in manila.conf has the authority to launch hdfs command.
2. Set run_as_root to False if there is no argument by default, all the cases in
Manila HDFS Driver don't need be a root to run hdfs command.
3. If root is required, please deliver run_as_root parameter and set it as True

Change-Id: I310713c3c1b74ff9990832f61e777cf4c12696fe
Closes-Bug: #1481567

commit_message:
Tune tweak::apache_wrappers module

- Sometimes apache fails to start after stop, due to unclosed
  resources. The problem frequently reproduced with keystone wsgi
  module, and didn't reproduced with horizon or radosgw.
  'apachectl restart' is recommended if doing start/stop rapidly
  https://wiki.apache.org/httpd/CouldNotBindToAddress
- Redefine restart => 'apachectl graceful' for apache service
- Remove disabling of GarbageCollector

Related-Bug: #1472675
Related-Bug: #1484066
Related-Bug: #1457893
Related-Bug: #1459357

Change-Id: I34843639eacc9bcb6d451d3376440c8bfe9014f7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-10 12:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/test_healthmonitor_basic.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/test_load_balancer_basic.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/base.py'], 'message': 'Refactor v2 scenario tests

When api and scenario tests were copied from tempest and
test_health_monitor_basic was added, scenario code suffered a
number of changes which introduced some code duplication and
affected test performance (i.e. test_load_balancer_basic booted
two instances instead of just one).

This change refactors scenario tests by:
  1. Moving common setup code into base.py.
  2. Setting up test resources at test level instead of class level
     to allow adding new test cases to these classes in the future.
  3. Performing addCleanup at resource creation.
  4. Booting one instance instead of two in test_load_balancer_basic.
  5. Reduce interval to 1 sec and timeout to 10 sec in
     _wait_for_load_balancer_status. This makes the test run faster
     while still leaving sufficient amount of time to wait for a load
     balancer to change its status.

Change-Id: Ib9733d1a9059f9801e6af8b116093666585f82a2
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor v2 scenario tests

When api and scenario tests were copied from tempest and
test_health_monitor_basic was added, scenario code suffered a
number of changes which introduced some code duplication and
affected test performance (i.e. test_load_balancer_basic booted
two instances instead of just one).

This change refactors scenario tests by:
  1. Moving common setup code into base.py.
  2. Setting up test resources at test level instead of class level
     to allow adding new test cases to these classes in the future.
  3. Performing addCleanup at resource creation.
  4. Booting one instance instead of two in test_load_balancer_basic.
  5. Reduce interval to 1 sec and timeout to 10 sec in
     _wait_for_load_balancer_status. This makes the test run faster
     while still leaving sufficient amount of time to wait for a load
     balancer to change its status.

Change-Id: Ib9733d1a9059f9801e6af8b116093666585f82a2

commit_message:
Correct .gitreview defaultbranch

During feature/qos merge into master branch, .gitreview has been
incorrectly updated with feature/qos .gitreview file. This change
rollbacks .gitreview update (and undefines defaultbranch).

Change-Id: I5b40aa5d4458985e1eeff5e7956b4d9dca073894

commit_message:
Inconsistent karma conf for xstatic files

The xstatic files in dashboard/karma.conf is missing the smart-table
reference causing tests that rely on smart-table to fail. This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I60ca60819f3a6ad525615dfdd6f6e6428c62d728
Closes-Bug: #1485746

commit_message:
Redundant tests removed from ovs-lib unit tests:

The idea here was to remove redundant unit tests.
The approach here has been that if the function being tested does not
implement any custom logic (apart from calling ovsdb), the unit test
does not help.

Refer to the bug description for more details of the specific tests
removed.

Change-Id: I35dc60bb714566c33f5cee5aab3e5b83bd0610e3
Closes-Bug: #1459811

commit_message:
Remove VIF_TYPES constant

VIF_TYPES[1] lists all vif types including out-of-tree ones BUT is no
more used by neutron code.

This changes removes it and every VIF_TYPE_* constant in [1] only used
by VIF_TYPES.

[1] in neutron.extensions.portbindings

Change-Id: I5bc24efd5b7df950468c67022b59e0c424f20753

subject: Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11903, 'name': 'Anthony Lee', 'email': 'anthony.mic.lee@hpe.com', 'username': 'leeantho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-18 19:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

--

NOTE(sahid): The TODO comment in the original change on master is
omitted here since os-brick wasn't used by nova in kilo so leaving
it in the backport would be confusing.

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772
"}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

--

NOTE(sahid): The TODO comment in the original change on master is
omitted here since os-brick wasn't used by nova in kilo so leaving
it in the backport would be confusing.

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772

commit_message:
Adds configurable agent type

This change introduces a new agent_type config option which
allows the ovs agent to be reused by out of tree
mechanism drivers.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I48f4be4b1d51bcff62e86e5814c12bd9bfa3c902
Closes-Bug: #1469871

commit_message:
Add config option to specify ovs datapath.

This change introduces a new datapath_type parameter
to allow specification of the ovs datapath to be used.
This change introduces a new functional and unit tests.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I929d8d15fc6cfdb799c53ef0f3722f4ed5c1096d
Partial-Bug: #1469871

commit_message:
Switch Pure volume drivers to use Snapshot Objects

Some consistency group operations require looking up snapshot objects
and returning them. Now that we have Snapshot objects we should be using
those.

Change-Id: Ib4ff7fa3f7d768abb33e3b9436f7e64a3cd81f4c
Closes-Bug: #1458126

master.

commit_message:
Better error messages from invalid sample tasks

An invalid sample JSON task file gave an error message that didn't
give the filename. This commit fixes that, and does some minor cleanup
around invalid YAML tasks.

Change-Id: I21f38e015e310a6450286f700c634ebd03eec5be

commit_message:
Revert "Remove default service provider from conf file"

Now that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/213750/ has merged,
which addresses the root issue, this symptom fixer, which has
quite a few side effects, can be reverted until it's addressed
sanely.

This reverts commit f9d5c0505752b5720beab589f9d76573740a695e.

Change-Id: Ie013b452457b460de798c5d5d06133784d2f321f

Sometime during the split, code was added to fixup driver paths,

in use. That, combined with neutron including default service
providers for VPN and LOADBALANCER, resulted in a really messy
mess in terms of removing VPN from the main neutron test suites.

commit_message:
Don't fatal error during initialization for missing service providers

Sometime during the split, code was added to fixup driver paths,
which imports service providers even for plugins which are not
in use. That, combined with neutron including default service
providers for VPN and LOADBALANCER, resulted in a really messy
mess in terms of removing VPN from the main neutron test suites.

This change stops the imports, so that if one of the services is
missing, neutron server can still start. It likely breaks the driver
path fixup, which can be fixed outside of this gate blockage.

Closes-Bug: #1483266
Change-Id: I23f9007357d8cbbae599997c244561a4e2f32ce1

commit_message:
Json file should without chef banner

The format of the default chef banner is not considered as a comment in
json file. The comment for json file should start with "//" or "/* */".

This patch remove the chef banner in glance metadata template.

Change-Id: I70d3f3d5d03704880c66a850a38441084154a62e
Closes-Bug: #1485893

The 'override' value of an option is currently stored and retrieved
with the exact value that is set through set_override method - not
taking into account the type of that option. Sometimes we want the type
of the override value to be the same as the option type and therefore
we will add an optional parameter to the set_override method that will

commit_message:
Add enforce_type option when setting an override

The 'override' value of an option is currently stored and retrieved
with the exact value that is set through set_override method - not
taking into account the type of that option. Sometimes we want the type
of the override value to be the same as the option type and therefore
we will add an optional parameter to the set_override method that will
enforce the option value type.

Closes-Bug: #1461299
Change-Id: I008b76d3292f76d0699f0063930a3b190539740f

commit_message:
Updates the Rework API specification to better surface conceptual

We need to try to make the conceptual information more findable
even while working on a way to integrate these concept topics with
the reference information. So, updating the spec to list the work
items we can do in the meantime.

Change-Id: Id5d3a307e1df9d72939c99c5ffdf2f2aedbba2f5

commit_message:
Cleanup for VPNaaS plugin

With a DevStack plugin added to the VPNaaS repo, this commit
removes the VPN logic from DevStack.

In addition, to allow grenade to check if the VPN service is
running for upgrades, modified the is_service_enabled, to allow
a devstack plugin to specify a service name with hyphens and
will convert to underscores to be able to call a custom
is_<service-name>_enabled method.

For this to pass tests, we need to have previously excluded
the q-vpn service from devstack based tests. Added dependency
on commits for that.

Change-Id: Iffa9901e24adbacb581425c4b38c7e8cff0da9e8
Closes-Bug: 1473475
Depends-On: Idd5524ed0b602408be5a53830981a8ab974b390c
